Four special characters. Three are immune to one of the weapons (knife, pistol, sniper rifle) and the other requires two actions to kill. Killing 1/2/3/4 of these characters earns 1/3/6/9 points.
187261.name: 10' to Kill: Expansions

187262.name: Rocket Squad
187262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rocket Squad is a story roleplaying game about the 7th Empire’s War to gain control of the skies. The final days of freedom lay before us. The previous commanders were so focused on the ground assault that no one thought to look to the heavens. Big mistake. Characters are the elite commandos of the Rocket Squad, tasked with defending the Earth from an endless series of raids. Lord Belafor’s marauding airships seem to be everywhere, giving you little time to prepare for the next wave of attacks. Does the Squad have what it takes for one last jetpack assault against Lord Belafor’s flagship?
Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

187263.name: Damascus
187263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Damascus is a story roleplaying game about aging heroes — heroes who’ve been given one final shot at glory. But as they take up blades and banners for king and country, a question arises: who is the glory for? As the reality behind the legends blurs into the fading light of an age gone by, will the characters find their own sense of morality changed in a world of dead heroes?

Damascus is inspired by such works as The Aeneid, The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, Don Quixote, Hamlet, The Idiot, To Kill a Mockingbird, The Stranger, and any story about heroes who fight causes passionately, even if those battles need not be fought.
Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

187264.name: Lady Winter
187264.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lady Winter is a story roleplaying game about the land of Fey and the mysteries of the unknown. As druids, fey, sidhe, witches, and all manner of creatures prepare for the arrival of Lady Winter, the sky grows dark and the air cold. Characters take on the role of community leaders charged with bringing gifts to Lady Winter, in the hope that she bestows kindness upon them. But Lady Winter is fickle and her temper unpredictable. Will she bring salvation? Or will she toy with the land of myth until the thaw of Spring?

White as snow, cold as death
Lady Winter comes
‘Lo to those who refuse to bow before the coming tempest

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.
Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

187265.name: Blackheart
187265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all heroes play nice. For that matter, not all heroes are nice. Blackheart certainly isn't. Source of terror for criminals and monsters far and wide, she gets the job done no matter how badly she has to traumatize the bad guys unfortunate enough to get in her way while she does it. She goes into the dark places other heroes hesitate to enter, doesn't hesitate to get her hands dirty doing the right thing, and has decades of experience making the worst kinds of walking nightmares wet themselves when they find out she's coming for them. Help her or stay out of her way, she doesn't care which one you choose.

Blackheart is a PL 11 character to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

187266.name: Gegenangriff am Kasserine
187266.description:
GaK is a basically regiment-to-(Italian )division minigame about the Axis counteroffensive 14-22Feb43 in Tunisia. There are 9 1-day turns. The Axis have 9 units plus Rommel himself, and the Allies start with 6 U.S. (from 1st Armored and 34th Infantry Divisions) and 2 French units. At 10mis/16kms per hex, zones of control do not stop enemy movement but can interdict supply.

The U.S. (and French) must conduct a fighting withdrawal or lose victory points for losing villages/positions too quickly, to try to set up solid defenses in the hills, valleys, and (Kasserine) passes.

The game plays in an hour (or less, the instant the Germans take strategic objective Thala). There are Tiger( tanks)s. The British 6th Armoured Division is an optional, strategically costly reinforcement. The game is free to print off and play from CoatneyHistory.

187267.name: The Techno Player's Guide
187267.description:
Publisher blurb:

This wondrous guide to the "Techno" style of play covers:

-everything you need to play in a Techno-based Chuubo's Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG game;
-a detailed study of Discovery, Foreshadowing, Sympathetic Action, and Shock;
-two brand new XP emotions;
-a useful guide to Arcs and quests;
-an introduction to "MP Shops," giving even mortal PCs access to miracles; and
-the new "Battle Mode" Ritual, complete with two detailed examples!

Have you been looking for a shorter introduction to Chuubo's play than the full 576-page rulebook? Have you been wondering what the Techno mode of play might be like? The answers are all within the pages of this volume.

Enjoy!

This book is an introduction and guide to one of the eight modes or "genres" of Chuubo's Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG play. You will still need the core rulebook to run a game or to create a character unassisted.

187268.name: The Chuubo's Marvelous Wish Granting Engine Halloween Special
187268.description:
Publisher blurb:

If you love the Chuubo’s Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG, and who doesn't? Then you'll want to pick up this marvelous introduction to its "Fairy Tales" genre---

An 80-XP campaign for 2-4 players featuring:

-The Headmaster, a Halloween-obsessed drunk;
-The Ideologue, led astray by the "Blood Fang" books;
-The Idol, who doesn't really want to be this story's hero; and
-The Exchange Student, from the Halloween World on the other side of the mirror...
as well as extensive notes as to how a Fairy Tales campaign plays out!

This book is meant for use as a one-shot campaign for new or experienced players, and some game features have been simplified and some choices constrained in pursuit of that end. Much of the book's Halloween-themed art has appeared previous to this product, but you know you want to buy it anyway.

You will need the Chuubo’s Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG, or, at least, someone in your group had better have the Chuubo’s Marvelous Wish-Granting Engine RPG, to play.

Enjoy! And happy holidays!

187270.description:
Among the Stars: Spiel 2014 Tournament Cards is a card set that was given to people participating in the Among the Stars tournament held at the event Spiel 2014 in Essen.

The card set contains previously released cards from the base game with different artwork;


3x Limited edition Power Reactor cards (alternative artwork)
2x Limited edition Heavy Ion Cannon location cards (alternative artwork)
2x Limited edition School of Alien Cultures location cards (alternative artwork)
187270.name: Among the Stars: Spiel 2014 Tournament Cards

187271.name: Pure Shoujo
187271.description:
User summary:

Pure Shoujo is set in a high school and concerns itself with the romantic alliances and friendships that form and break in that setting. The setting is infused with Manga elements. Players may choose to play multiple characters. The game uses D6 and D12 and a stripped pack of playing cards. One player is called the Dealer (Game Master), who deals cards, rolls (randomizes) scenes, and breaks ties. Otherwise, the game is a shared narrative.

Characters have a gender and a concept, as well as Virtues (Attributes) including: Honor, Cunning, Discernment, Passion, Style, Beauty, and Prowess. Virtues can be randomized or purchase from a point pool, as desired. Characters also have three Specialties (Skills) which are player-defined, and three Secrets. During play whenever two dice are rolled and match (e.g., a 1 and a 1, or a 6 and a 6) one or two cards are laid and the cards determine the generic sort of action which next occurs (e.g., "Going Steady: Elevate a friend to an SO, or an SO to a True Love").

For any non-trivial action, dice are rolled and compared to an appropriate Virtue. "Rolling under" the Virtue indicates success. Modifiers apply upon the Dealer's determination. If an action is opposed by another player and a compromise cannot be quickly evolved, then a vote is solicited from the other players.

The rules present a sample high school with a supporting cast. This setting is quite basic.

187272.name: Gothos
187272.description:
User Summary

An FMV adventure game revolving around vampire clans. Play as a male or female vampire and explore the city of Gothos from a first person perspective.

The game was created with Macromedia Director.

208019.name: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game: Fan Favorites

187273.description:
Description from the publisher:

In The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game, players work together to solve cases from the bestselling Dresden Files novels in the ultimate what-if scenario: What if Harry was on the scene with allies who weren't there in the original story? Play Harry, Murphy, Susan, Michael, and the Alphas in the first five novels, or take on "Side Jobs" in a random scenario generator based on the short story collection of the same name.

Play your hand, clear the board, and beat the odds in the final showdown at the end of the book. Use teamwork, strategy, and a wee bit of luck to win the day.

The game has plenty of in-jokes and references for Dresden fans (like the unreliable range of the Blue Beetle), but it’s accessible to people who haven’t read the books.

This is a tightly tuned, strategic, cooperative game that feels intense, vital, and a little bit risky (thanks to dice and other factors) throughout play. At 30 minutes per session, gameplay is fast-paced and down to the wire. In this game, players take on the role of Harry Dresden and his allies, investigating cases and taking on foes from the books. To accomplish this, you'll share a common pool of action points (called Fate points), and each player must choose between taking an action or generating Fate points each turn. Solve more cases than there are foes left standing to win!

In short, each player plays a character from the novels (one of them is always Harry), taking on a shuffled scenario deck based on one of the books in the series. Using a combination of cards, dice, and teamwork, players attack foes, investigate cases, take advantages, and overcome obstacles to make sure they have the best possible odds for a win in the final showdown at the end of the book! Like any good cooperative game, it's hard to win (no fun if there's no challenge!), but always rewarding to play, and scales smoothly from one to five players.
187273.name: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game

187274.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 84 - Oct 2015)
187274.description:
Bring a Whole New Perspective to Your GURPS Game!

Sometimes the most amazing thing you can do with your gaming is to look at things from a new angle, shake things up, and challenge your perspectives. This issue of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - is devoted to looking at things from a different point of view. Its senses-stretching articles include:


"The Long and the Short of It," Sean Punch's supplement-length look at how extremes of time and space can call for special scrutiny in GURPS, in the same vein as the advice from How to Be a GURPS GM. Whether your campaigns are set in a tiny hamlet or the endless multiverse, or whether they're one-shots or span generations, you'll learn how to ensure your campaigns are balanced and fun!
"The Disappearance of Father Cohen," this month's Eidetic Memory from GURPS Abydos author David L. Pulver. In this adventure - suitable for GURPS Horror or lower-powered GURPS Monster Hunters heroes - the investigators must determine whether Father Cohen was working for good or ill, what his goals were, and how to defeat a greater evil!
"Heroes on the Mass Scale," an in-depth guide to translating adventurers into the GURPS Mass Combat system. Zooming out from furious personal melee to larger tactical battles has never been easier!
"The Elvey Institute," an odd organization (with GURPS Boardroom and Curia stats) that takes a very long view on solving the world's problems.


This issue also presents a Random Thought Table that offers more ideas for different perspectives, plus Odds and Ends that expand the options for the Elvey Institute and feature a behind-the-scenes look at the gorgeous Brandon Moore cover. Your campaign can always benefit from a new point of view, and this issue might be just what you need to look at things with fresh eyes!

- Publisher's description

187275.name: QCarz
187275.description:
User summary:

QCarz is an armed and armored automobile combat game, played with pencil and paper on a tabletop; it incorporates light-weight role-playing elements to allow for drivers (characters) to persist through multiple scenarios and gain experience and capabilities. The clear focus of the game remains on automobile combat simulation. QCarz was developed from the author's earlier game Carz which was devoid of all role-playing elements. QCarz was published in at least three versions; the version 2.0 presented here was the final edition and also the first edition to include role-playing elements.

Drivers (characters) in the game have four Attributes: Agility, Power, Endurance, and Brains. Attributes have a numeric rating from 1-10 (randomized or purchased from a random point pool) and are rolled against with D10 to determine non-trivial actions. Note that during automobile combat, the driver does not function as a character, per se, but as a component of the vehicle. If the car being used has multiple "crew spaces" then the player may populate each space with a character.

187276.name: Snapstories
187276.description:
Tell me a story.
Not the usual made up kind, but one from real life - your own real life!
We are all full of stories, and Snapstories brings them out into the open.

All you have to do is draw a card, and get inspired by the text ... it could be "That scared me" or "I felt loved" or any of 98 other cards. Turn the sand timer, and start you story.

It doesn't have to be a great story or a long one, just tell it like you remember it. After 3 minutes at the most, you are done, and the next player is up.
Did you get stuck? No panic, we have cards to help you out, so just draw one of those.

What do the other players do during your story?
They Listen!

If you want to add anything to a story, or hear more about it, you will have to play one your tokens - and you only have two for the whole game.

Snapstories brings people together across generations, across cultures and across the table. The game can engage anyone, anywhere, because the subject is life - your life!

187277.description:
Les cent-heures de Waterloo (Hundred Hours of Waterloo) is a two-player game that brings into play Napoleon's dramatic and final campaign in Belgium in June 1815.
One player controls the Army of the North (hereafter called the French player) and the other the Anglo-Dutch and Prussian factions (hereafter called the Allied player).

Players are moving 1/2 corps on a "point to point" map.

(source: rulebook and user's description)
187277.name: Les cent-heures de Waterloo, la campagne de Belgique de 1815

187278.name: Blind Mythos
187278.description: Blind Mythos is a cooperative game with eight scenarios in which players try to collect banned materials during play to resolve the situation presented in the scenario.

187279.name: Trivial Pursuit Letterario
187279.description:
From the publisher (translated):

First literary edition of Trivial Pursuit.
The rules are the same of the classic game, but the topic is different: in here, there are only questions about Literature.
1.200 questions, with different levels of difficulty, sort by color: Ancient Literature, Foreing Literature, Italian Literature, Movie Literature, Theatrical and Lyrical Literature, Mistery Literature.

User summary:
The object of the game is to move around the board by correctly answering trivia questions.
Once a player has collected one wedge of each color and filled up his/her playing piece, he or she must return to the hub and answer a question in a category selected by the other players. If this question is answered correctly, that player wins the game.

Original description:

Parliamo della prima versione esclusivamente letteraria di uno dei titoli storici e di maggior successo prodotti dalla società statunitense. La struttura e le regole del gioco sono le stesse del classico Trivial Pursuit ma quello che cambia è l’argomento trattato: la letteratura, infatti, è il topic su cui vertono le domande a cui si deve rispondere. Le categorie selezionate e contrassegnate da diversi colori sono: Letteratura antica, Letteratura straniera, Letteratura italiana, Letteratura nel cinema, Letteratura nel teatro e nella lirica e infine Letteratura gialla.

Sono 1.200 le domande, di differente difficoltà, elaborate dalla redazione della casa editrice, che permetteranno di cimentarsi in appassionanti sfide intellettuali.

187280.description:
Zom Bees eating your Boo Bees before they can evade Spiders and bring Flowers back to the Hive to make HONEY! ...and stuff like that :)

Zone based battling battling Bees bent on sabotage while you try to convince everyone around you that someone else is WAY MORE threatening than you.

Get flowers from the center Flower Pots and bring them back to your Hive to be turned into Honey. The first player to successfully gain 5 Honey pots (or however many you pick at the beginning of the game) Wins the Game!
187280.name: Hive Mind

187281.name: The Folio #02
187281.description:
From the back cover:

A series of small earthquakes have brought a sense of disquiet to the town of Daern Kelton and Roslof Keep. Against these strange earthly portents, the members of the Ivory Scimitar have claimed their place as a true Mithel Company, but even greater danger now awaits them in the second level of the Dungeon of the Black Fey Mithelvarn. What lost secrets will be revealed as they journey below? What new threats and adventures can be had in Daern Kelton? The town now opens its doors to the brave new heroes of the Company of the Ivory Scimitar. Here continues the Roslof Keep Campaign in the pages of ROS2, The Tremors in the Machine.


User summary:

Includes:

Two-panel removable cardstock cover with color interior maps (4 pp.)
Gazetteer NR2 Daern Kelton booklet including new monster entry (Lowl) plus "Dungeon Master's Notes & Suggestions on Running the Dungeon" article (12 pp.)
ROS2 Beneath Roslof Keep adventure booklet (24 pp.)

187282.description:
(from the introduction:)

Fall Gelb is a simulation of the campaign between the Axis and the Western Allies in Europe in 1940. It consists of amalgamated components of Game Designer's Workshops Europa series of military simulations, including Fall of France, Their Finest Hour, Narvik and Spain and Portugal. It uses the current rule set from Fire In the East, with some modifications, plus completely new (unofficial and experimental) air, naval and political rules. It models the strategic and operational options open to the Wehrmacht as its focus turned to the Western Allies.
They may choose to repeat historical options, or find a new and more successful strategy. The scenario opens with the German Army redeployed after the dlsmemberment of Poland. The OA for both sides is historically accurate for that period.

Fall Gelb is intended for use by Europa buffs who have wanted to get their hands on a simulation covering the campaign in the West using available Europa components.


Contents:

Rules (v1: 11 pages, v2: 23 pages)
Orders of battle (v1: 7 pages, v2: 16 pages)
Tables (v1&v2:1 page)
Ship status sheet (v1: 6 pages, v2: 7 pages)
Strategic display (v1: 2 pages, v2: 3pages)
Port chart (v1: 6 pages, v2: 7 pages)
Air Wing Display (v1&v2: 2 pages)
Task Force Composition Chart (3 pages)
Air Units Dummy Sheets (v2 only: 2 pages)
Atlantic Chart (v1&v2: 2 pages)
187282.name: Fall Gelb

187283.name: Dragons' Eggs
187283.description:
In Dragons' Eggs, players use their treasure cards to bid on egg cards, and whoever has the most eggs at the end of the game wins.

In more detail, each player starts with a hand of eleven numbered treasure cards and one ability card; the deck of egg cards is shuffled, then one card revealed. Each player plays one or two treasure cards from hand in turn, revealing one of the cards if they played two. Each player in turn draws an ability card, then plays or discards one ability card. They reveal and resolve these ability cards simultaneously, then see who wins the round and claims the egg card.

A player can pass on bidding in a round by discarding one of the egg cards they've previously collected.

187284.name: Boundless
187284.description:
Whether you are a seasoned hunter, a weathered explorer, a master builder, a shrewd trader or a natural born fighter, there is a place for you in the massive open-world sandbox universe of Boundless. Watch the sunrise on one world before hunting down epic Titans on another. Explore caverns on your own or build a city with your guild. Mine, trade or fight Protectors for resources and search for elusive Oort technology.

Source: The Game Website.

187285.name: The Folio #03
187285.description:
From the back cover:

What began as a subtle sickness has now spread into a full-blown contagion of magical origins around Roslof Keep! Although protected from the outbreak by their Mithel Standard, the Company of the Ivory Scimitar is now challenged with not only continuing their quest to defeat the Dungeon but also saving the town that they have grown to love. With unlikely allies forming from the other Mithel Companies, as well as unforeseen help within the labyrinth itself, the Ivory Scimitar must now take on the perilous task of curing the Violet Corruption while trying to discern the nature of its cause from somewhere deep within Mithelvarn's mad dungeon of self-propagating monstrosities!


User summary:

Includes:

Two-panel removable cardstock cover with color interior maps (4 pp.)
Gazetteer NR3 The Violet Corruption & The Infernal Machine booklet including new monster entry (Jai-Ruk) plus "Dungeon Master's Notes & Suggestions on Running the Dungeon" article (12 pp.)
ROS3 Curse of the Violet Corruption! adventure booklet (24 pp.)

187286.name: コクーン・ワールド　ザ・ボードゲーム (Cocoon World: The Board Game)
187286.description:
コクーン・ワールド　ザ・ボードゲーム (Cocoon World: The Board Game) is a racing game in which the players construct the board while they play. On a turn, a player rolls one or more dice in the dice tower, move their pawn, then places a tile on the game board that, for example, moves their pawn again forward or backward a specified number of spaces or rewarded them experience points (EPs).

In general, the player who has the most EPs wins, but the game includes five scenarios that change the rules and goals somewhat.

187287.name: The Folio #04
187287.description:
From the back cover:

Chaos reigns outside Roslof Keep, and the spread of the violet corruption runs deep within Mithelvarn's Dungeon. Now, the Company of the Ivory Scimitar must not only face the challenges of the Roslof delve, but will also find that the dangers of the Kelmalin Wildlands must be overcome as well if they are ever to get to the bottom of the deadly plague that ravages the land. Time is running out, and only those brave enough will be able to face the horrors of the Glade of the Burning Dead and the dark recesses of The Hill.


User summary:

Includes:

Two-panel removable cardstock cover with color interior maps (4 pp.)
Gazetteer NR4 Kelmalin Wildlands booklet including new monster entry (Kin) plus "Dungeon Master's Notes & Suggestions on Running the Dungeon" article (12 pp., numbered 3-14)
ROS4 Glade of the Burning Dead adventure booklet (20 pp., numbered 3-22)

187288.name: No Foolish Matter
187288.description:
From the introduction:

Some of the hamlets outlying Hillsfar have been struck by an odd malady. Rumor has it a traveling carnival visited those hamlets before the disease struck. Does coincidence not equal causation or is something sinister afoot? A two-hour adven-ture for 1st-4th level characters.

187289.description:
In the crazy cat-collecting game Here, Kitty, Kitty!, your neighborhood has a cat problem, the problem being that the cats don't all belong to YOU! Unfortunately you can't just grab them for yourself as everyone in the neighborhood wants to claim those adorable kitties. Outwit your fellow feline fiends as you lure cats onto your property, move cats into your house, and steal cats from your neighbors. All's fair in love and cat-collecting!

In the game, each player chooses a Property board, which contains three zones: the Yard, the Porch, and the House. At the end of the game, cats in the House are worth 5 points each, cats on the Porch are worth 3 points each, and cats in your Yard are worth 0 points. However, having cats in your Yard does have advantages for special scoring conditions, such as having the most cats of a single color or the most cats overall. All 40 cat miniatures are placed in the center of the table, and represent the Neighborhood. Each player is dealt 2 or 3 cards, depending on the number of players in the game.

On each player's turn, they perform two Actions: moving a cat, playing a card, or discarding cards. Cats can be moved 1 space for 1 Action, by picking up the cat and putting it in the next zone of the property. For example, a cat can be moved from the Neighborhood to the Yard for 1 Action, or from the Yard to the Porch or from the Porch to the Yard (and vice versa). Playing cards may allow a player to move multiple cats at once, to move cats multiple spaces, to steal cats from opponents, or to make opponents give up cats. A player may also choose to discard 1, 2, or 3 cards as an Action. Once both Actions have been taken, the player draws back up to a full hand, and play passes to the person to the left. If an Instant card (red border) is drawn, it is played immediately and affects the entire group. The player then draws a replacement card for the Instant card until a full hand is achieved.

The final round is triggered when a player draws the last card from the draw pile. From that point every player, including the player who drew the last card, has one final turn to maximize their score. Then, the cats are counted and a winner is lauded for their purr-procurement proficiency.
187289.name: Here, Kitty, Kitty!

187290.name: Shayō: Kit d'initiation
187290.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Devastated a long time ago by the Tenbatsu [divine wrath], ruthless samurai, wandering techs looking for relics of the ancient world, blind priestesses or mad exorcists, messengers traveling across the wastelands, the characters swore allegiance to the neo-shogunate, the only power now able to protect the land from the fearsome oni and mutants.

Will you save the empire from the ghosts of the past?

187291.name: Player's Guide (1st Edition)
187291.description:
From the preface:

Quasar is a Science Fiction role-playing game. It is described in several manuals. This manual is intended for players and Game Masters alike. Other manuals are for the Game Master's eyes only.

This manual is divided into four parts. Part I describes how to create your player character. Part II describes the basics of how to play. Part III covers a wide range of various topics useful for when questions arise during play. Part IV contains reference material. It is best for the beginner to read through parts I and II first, then begin playing a Quasar scenario. When necessary, parts III and IV can be referenced.

187292.name: GM Reference (1st Edition)
187292.description:
From the preface:

This reference work contains information that is solely for the GM of a Quasar campaign whereas the Player's Guide describes the basic game mechanics. The players may eventually learn some of the information in this guide, but only in the course of play. This assumes a good working knowledge of the Quasar Player's Guide and Creature Anthology. This guide is divided into two parts. Part I describes how to referee a game, how the GM should handle specific game situations and provides information not readily available to the PCs. Part II contains various tables used to generate treasures, NPCs, etc. as well as a description of some of the more flashy technology, including alien artifacts.

187293.name: Creature Anthology (1st Edition)
187293.description:
From the preface:

This manual describes many of the common or notable creatures that can be encountered in the Quaser game. Note that "creature" does not necessarily indicate a living being. Each creature is described briefly and various statistics appear with the description.

User summary:

Each entry is organized alphabetically and follows a similar entry format with a common "stat block" layout.

187294.name: Errata and FAQ (2nd Edition)
187294.description:
User summary:

A second edition of Quasar was contemplated and received preliminary work but was apparently never completed. Between the 1st and 3rd editions of the game an online FAQ was maintained that clarified rules (with the stated intent of revising or updating referenced rules for second edition) and an online Errata was maintained that had the stated intent of presenting forthcoming rules for the 2nd edition. None of the materials presented were substantive changes or significant from a systems perspective.

The 2nd edition effort appears to have been abandoned after receiving minimal work in favor of the third edition.

187295.description: A set of high quality Metal Bonus Tokens which will be 6 each of 5 different token sculpts to replace the cardboard tokens in the core box of Thunderbirds.
187295.name: Thunderbirds: Metal Bonus Tokens

187297.name: Round-Up
187297.description:
A Riders of the Range action party game for children.

Any number of players can be cowboys finding small cards representing cattle. An organiser hides the cards around the playing area. Each card bears a number representing the number of head of cattle (20, 30, or 40). The player who finds the most head of cattle wins.

187298.name: Titan Walker
187298.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the ultra heavy Titan Class Walker in two variations.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

187299.name: Snow White
187299.description:
From publisher blurb:

Snow White is an adventurous fairy tale compatible with Dungeons & Dragons 3.5 and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, designed for four to six 6th-8th level characters.

Love is firmly in the northern air of the Klavek Kingdom, as what started as a marriage of political practicality has turned into the real thing. The Prince of the mighty Klavek Kingdom has met the true love of his life, Lumi Valtatytar, daughter of Lord Herttua Valta of Morsain. Lumi is loved by everyone for her intelligence, kindness, and not least, for her grace and beauty (which are beyond compare).

But the path of true love rarely runs smoothly; the PCs, initially there to help at the wedding, find themselves involved with assassination attempts, political intrigue, dastardly machinations, insurgents, and even murder! At every turn, someone or something seems determined to stop the party from getting Lumi to the church on time. Who is behind all these devious mischief and can they be caught? There’s plenty for the PCs to reflect on as they make every effort to ensure the marriage of the year goes ahead, while fighting to clear their names at the same time.

Suddenly and without warning, Lumi disappears; the party is responsible for tracking her down and returning her safely to Castle Morsain. Their quest won’t be easy as they must first enter the dreaded Haunted Forest and deal with the seven short folk responsible for Lumi’s abduction.

During their journey the PCs must evade a bottomless pit ravenously following them through the woods, explore the fabled Feyglade, and escape a forest maze and its minotaur guardian. Then the party will come face-to-face with the short folk and a wizened crone before rescuing Lumi and returning to Morsain, where they find themselves under attack as someone tries to prevent them from getting back to the castle.

Snow White spans nearly 250 pages and includes:

Multiple paths to reach each stage of the story
Detailed cartography mapping of a full-scale castle
A new multi-stage poison, “Assassin Vine Cocktail”
Rules for running a high speed chase on horseback through a forest
The Alchemist's Journal, detailing the various flora & fauna in the Haunted Forest
New creatures, including the Twisted Treant, Bottomless Pit and Gravewrap
Fairy tale-themed traps, such as the Binding Rocking Chair
New magic items, including the amulet of sleep, bed of alertness and orb of misleading
Multiple possible endings to the tale, depending upon the players’ actions throughout the adventure
Game mechanics for falling in love—the heart rules the head!
Gorgeous maps by Tommi Salama
And of course, all those essential fairy tale elements; a beautiful heroine, a prince, a queen, a magic mirror, and a hidden cabin in a haunted forest

187300.name: Outpost 254-563 (1st Edition)
187300.description:
From the Introduction:

Outpost 254-563 is a small outpost of the Imperial Federation, located on the far fringe of the populated galaxy in an unexplored region. It is located on an asteroid in a small solar system with no habitable worlds. It serves as the hub for a mining community that has just begun to extract ore from the asteroid belt. It also serves as a small advance military presence.

User summary:

Outpost 254-563 is an introductory scenario for new players. It also can serve as a "home base" for a campaign. Note the HTML and DOC versions have three black and white maps as part of the document while the RTF version has the same maps as three separate GIF files. Textually, the three versions are the same and vary only in layout and file format.

The Outpost 254-563 introductory scenario was retained (without significant changes) in all editions of the game.

187301.name: Rulah, Jungle Goddess
187301.description:
From publisher blurb:

"You have proven your wisdom and strength. You are a goddess.
We name you Rulah!"

In 1947, depressed over the death of her fiancee, wealthy daredevil Jane Dodge left the United States to fly her plane around the world. She disappeared somewhere over Africa... and that's where her story really begins.

Rulah, Jungle Goddess features four weird tales of jungle adventure from the Golden Age of Comics, starring an American woman who, after being stranded in a remote part of the African jungle, comes to be worshipped as a god by a local tribe. She finds herself fighting all manner of jungle beasts, Nazis, winged horrors, and more, all in defense of the people who have placed their trust in her.

In addition to the comics, Rulah, Jungle Goddess contains feats and talent trees for d20 Modern that will let players make living gods and goddesses like Rulah -- including ones that actually possess godlike powers.

187302.name: Player's Guide (3rd Edition)
187302.description:
From the Introduction:

This role-playing science-fiction/fantasy game is not a simulation, but is intended to be realistic and firmly rooted in the known physical universe. Each player can have as his or her goal anything they desire. The Game Master (GM) is impartial and fair in all matters related to game play. As a realistic game, magic and psionics are left out of play. This manual is designed to be a complete game system in and of itself. Optional rules are provided for more realistic play at the expense of smooth game flow. It is generally desirable to create new characters rather than transfer some from another role-playing game.

User summary:

The DOC, RTF, and HTML versions have identical content and vary only in minor formatting issues and file format. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

187303.name: GM Reference (3rd Edition)
187303.description:
From the Introduction:

Quasar is played with one GM (Game Master) and one or more players, each of whom has a PC (Player Character) through which he acts during the game. The play takes place via the imagination, where the GM is responsible for setting up the atmosphere and resolving issues that come up during play. Typically, a gaming session (or a series of sessions) are run by the GM under the guidance of a scenario. The scenario is basically a story, of which only parts are made known to the players. Additional information usually becomes available during the course of play. The GM uses the scenario to set up the atmosphere, provide an adventuring hook, and determine what the characters see during play. An adventuring hook is simply the means by which the characters are drawn into the scenario. It could be as simple as someone hiring them for something, or as subtle as something happening around them, wherever they are. The scenario defines locations, objects in those locations, creatures that occupy or pass through those locations, and NPC (non-player characters) which the players interact with. It is the GM's job to adjust the reactions of the various creatures and NPCs depending upon the actions (or lack thereof) of the characters.

User summary:

The DOC, RTF, and HTML versions have identical content and vary only in minor formatting issues and file format. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

187304.name: Creature Anthology (3rd Edition)
187304.description:
User summary:

The Creature Anthology is presented withe entries in alphabetical order. Each entry has a name, a description (often brief), and a common "stat block" that includes Frequency, Number Appearing, Defensive Bonus, Movement, Habitat, Number of Attacks per Round, Damage per Attack, Level, % in Lair, Size, Intelligence, Experience Points, and Treasure Type. Supplementary materials include a treasure table, encounter tables for various environments, and in index.

The DOC, RTF, and HTML versions have identical content and vary only in formatting issues and file type. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

Note the 3rd Edition of the Creature Anthology was "published" again with the release date of the 5th Edition; but aside from one date on the copyright page these two publications are identical.

187305.description:
You're in a bar, chicks and dudes are everywhere, tonight is the night when two (or more) become one.
Who are you going to pay drinks to? Who will you hang out with?
And who will you bring home or somewhere else to do what consenting adults do?
Find out in Get Laid!, the hilarious game about the game.
Where the player with the craziest bangs is crowned the true player.

In Get Laid!, the goal is to bang. Bangs earn different points depending on the person the player bangs and on the location where he bangs.
When a player bangs, all other players may attack or assist the bang.
Players compete to score the most points before the end of the game.

The game ends when a player bangs 5 times or when the draw deck is exhausted.
The points of the cards of the bangs are then counted, and the player who scored the most points wins the game.
187305.name: Get Laid!

187306.name: Supporting Materials (3rd, 4th, 5th Edition)
187306.description:
User summary:

The 3rd Edition (2002) featured two additional resources:


The Master Index presents a unified index for the Player's Handbook and the GM Reference into a single alphabetical list. The DOC, RTF, and HTML versions have identical content and vary only in minor formatting issues and file type. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE)



Character Sheet (provided only in DOC format)


The 4th Edition (2004) added a Character Generator for MS Windows (an executable program that requires installation via a distribution package).

The 5th Edition (2007) provided updated versions of the Master Index (RTF and self-extracting DOC formats only) and the Character Sheet (DOC format). The previous Character Generator for MS Windows was replaced with a much extended Quasar RPG Referee Assistant for MS Windows (an executable program that requires installation via a distribution package).

187307.name: Planetary Engineer's Guide (4th Edition)
187307.description:
From the preface:

This guide is designed to assist people in the development of a complete mythos; that is, a fantasy universe. The focus here is on natural products and processes. The guide does not attempt to address sociopolitical, technoindustrial, or religious concerns. However, following the instructions herein can provide the environment in which societies, and their associated phenomena, develop.

User summary:

The guide is referred to as both the "Planetary" and the "Planet" Engineer's Guide. The guide itself constitutes the only significant change to the rules between the 3rd and 4th Editions of the game (the Player's Handbook received a minor revision). The guide was released in RTF and DOC format; both are identical except in very minor formatting. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

187308.name: Player's Guide (4th Edition)
187308.description:
User summary:

The 4th Edition Player's Guide was very similar to the 3rd Edition Player's Guide, varying only in minor updates and the addition of the Rogue Class. The 4th Edition of the game included the revised Player's Guide, the newly-released Planetary Engineer's Guide, and a Character Generator for MS Windows (EXE). Otherwise, the 4th Edition utilized existing 3rd Edition products without modification.

The book was released in RTF and DOC format; both are identical except in very minor formatting. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

187309.name: Gale Sayers Football
187309.description:
A professional football game licensed by Gale Sayers post-NFL career. A standard set of playing cards (with specially designed Gale Sayers card backs) is used. Players call out their play, pull a card, then check the play sheet to see what result the playing card provides. For instance, if you call a screen pass, then pull a red 10 out of the deck, that's a touchdown. A black 10 results in 0 yards gained.

Comes with board of football field, score board with two leg stands, Gale Sayers cardboard cutout figure and stand, ten-yard distance marker, two play results sheets, and deck of cards with two jokers.

Cover is marked Gale Sayers Football, but instructions always refer to game as Gale Sayers' Action Packed Football.

Of special note is the comment on the designer printed on the inside of the box: "This game was created by Don Kingston, with assistance on its refinement by his son, Kevin. Kevin Kingston perished, along with the entire University of Evansville Basketball Team on December 13, 1977. To his memory this game is dedicated."

187310.name: I Know An Old Woman

boardgamefamily.31232: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

187310.description:
In this game, based on the children's song about the old woman who swallowed a fly, players choose from a selection of creatures, each trying to catch the one selected by the other player. Whoever catches the most of the opponent's creatures, or plays the most that don't get caught, will be the winner.

The game is played with two mini-decks of nine cards, one for each player. Each deck contains cards representing creatures from the song: the horse, cow, goat, dog, cat, bird, spider, fly, and the old woman herself.

187311.name: Memo-Puzzle Der Blaue Reiter
187311.description:
The game plays much like the classic Memory, but instead of finding two matching pairs, the players have to find four matching cards. The four cards which belong together are not the same, but create a picture when put together.

If a player finds at least two matching cards, then they are left visible. The player, who finds the forth card to a set gets it. The player with the most sets at the end of a game wins.

All the art in this game is from a group of artists called 'Der Blaue Reiter' (Munich, Germany, from 1911 to 1914).
The box contains 72 different cards and a book with background information to the artists of all pictures.

187312.name: Player's Guide (5th Edition)
187312.description:
User summary:

The 5th Edition Player's Guide was very similar to the 4th Edition Player's Guide, varying only in minor corrections, additions, and clarifications. The 5th Edition of the game included the revised Player's Guide, a revised GM Reference, and the Quasar RPG Referee Assistant for MS Windows (EXE). Otherwise, the 5th Edition utilized existing 3rd Edition products without modification.

The guide was released in RTF and DOC format; both are identical except in very minor formatting. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

187313.name: Scratch House
187313.description:
The tile-laying game Scratch House takes its inspiration from the Winchester Mystery House, a bizarre mansion in San Jose, California owned by Sarah Winchester that was added on to continuously.

User summary:
Scratch House is a multi-player solitaire tile placement game. After your home is destroyed, fairies help you build a new house. But since they will live there too, they walk around the new rooms having a good look.

Players take turns collecting room tiles and spells from the board and then follow a solitaire process of building and scoring. The tiles show four portals, but 0-4 exit arrows which allow the fairies to walk only one way. Players can only build off arrows, so building is always with a mind to the next walk to score points as well as keeping it legal.

Fairies will not walk through unfinished rooms, and rooms don't become available until the build time is spent. All the tiles have a build cost, and players add to this cost how many steps to the nearest bedroom, and how many rooms built this turn to get the final cost. This is marked on the room with tokens.

Then build time is taken off each room according to which season you chose on the board. If you picked Spring, you get only 1 new tile but take 3 off each build time; Summer and Autumn get you 2 tiles and 2 off build times; Winter gives you 3 tiles but only 1 off build times. This means a balance forms between your house expanding quickly, or the rooms opening quickly, but not both together. Get it wrong and you restrict the walk and the chance to score points.

Add to this special effects in rooms to trigger bonus VPs, teleports, repainting and so on, Feng Shui to affect the fairies, spell cards to help you gain, extra steps for reaching bedrooms, and bonuses for seasons and colours, and there's a lot going on.

Production quality is high, the artwork is very good and the theme and the mechanics all work together nicely. Apart from the tile selection each round though, there is zero inter-action and players are really just trying to optimise their own builds and walks each time. The first edition of the game does not include English rules (downloadable though), despite full English on the cards and game box.

187315.name: GM Reference (5th Edition)
187315.description:
User summary:

The 5th GM Reference was very similar to the 3rd Edition GM Reference, varying only in minor corrections, additions, and clarifications. The 5th Edition of the game included the revised GM Reference, a revised Player's Guide, and the Quasar RPG Referee Assistant for MS Windows (EXE). Otherwise, the 5th Edition utilized existing 3rd Edition products without modification.

The reference was released in RTF and DOC format; both are identical except in very minor formatting. The DOC version was released as a self-extracting archive (EXE).

Confusingly, the GM Reference itself contains "Fourth Edition" on the copyright page but uses the release date of the 5th Edition of the game (and does not reference the date of the 4th Edition) and is referred to by other materials (including the download page) as the 5th Edition.

187316.name: Mark Lawrence's Horsemen of the Apocalypse
187316.description:
A chance to combine your interest in destroying the world, card games, and riding down innocents in order to doom your friends.

EVERYONE WHO PLAYS HORSEMEN OF THE APOCALYPSE DIES. Sorry.

The object is pretty straightforward. Be the last survivor...and ensure your (so-called) 'friends' are ridden down first. How? You do this by throwing innocents under the hooves of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse in order to slow them down.

Decks of cards contain the Horsemen: Death, Famine, War and Pestilence, and their Horses. They have arrived on Earth at the End of Days hell-bent on bringing doom and gloom to the world. Everything else in the game is designed to help you survive. For a time, at least.

Delay Cards are many and varied. They comprise the bulk of the game and include such things as hippies, a school bus, a beached whale, your grandmother, nurses, farmers, a basket of puppies...basically anything you can throw in front of the Horsemen to stop them from reaching you.

There are also Effect Cards, which include actions such as Swap, Shield, Force, and more. These cards allow a player to steal another player's defenders, or to turn a Horseman back against the previous player, or to force a player to put down any Horseman/Horse card in their hand.

According to the game's designer, Mark Lawrence, "the game is all about recklessly laying down innocent lives to eke out your own miserable survival, but to win you have to do it effectively. Each Horseman of the Apocalypse is unique. It’s going to take something very different to slow down Pestilence than to slow down Famine. If Death and War are both riding your way, throw the Diplomat under War’s hooves and the Doctor under Death’s, not the other way around."

187318.name: The Questing Beast (Version 2002)
187318.description:
A role-playing game of anthropomorphic fantasy in the world of King Arthur

From the introduction:

King Arthur's legend has inspired countless tales of heroic quests and romantic adventure. In this game, you combine Arthurian adventure with anthropomorphic characters to get a very unique role-playing experience: The Questing Beast.

This is a game of storytelling focused on cooperative play. You tell the story of a Hero - be it a fox seeking knighthood in the court of Camelot or a wolf bent on vengeance against her unfaithful lover. It is your tale. Your Romance.

User summary:

This version of the game was made freely available as an HTML document. When the commercial version of the game was released, this version was withdrawn.

187319.name: Ranma Nibun No Ichi
187319.description:
From the prologue:

Ranma Nibun No Ichi : The Storyteller Roleplaying Game of Martial Arts, Comedy and Romance is a way to use White Wolf's Storyteller system to recreate the genre of Ranma 1/2 and its possibilities as completely as possible. This is the sixth release of the game. This version was meant to be the first major version since 1 as denoted by being version 2. I wanted this version to be more easily navigable and usable for a complete roleplaying experience.

187320.name: Realms of Adventure
187320.description:
From the introduction:

Realms of Adventure...is set in the medieval era, with castles, magic, and fantastic creatures. You can play a knight, a wizard, a rogue, a crusading priest, or any other character you chose.

Realms of Adventure is designed to be compatible with the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons game. Dungeons & Dragons was the 1st RPG with is origins dating back to 1974. As a result over the many years a great amount of useful supporting material has been published for it: adventure settings, world settings, monsters, spells, and magic items. So Realms of Adventure has been designed to take advantage of them and is fully compatible with those supplements.

187321.description:
Expand both your Thunderbirds Board Game and Thunderbirds Roleplaying Game experiences with this set of two Thunderbirds dice, and get ready to roll for your life.

Each six side die has the silhouette of the nefarious Hood occupying one face, so make sure you avoid that on critical rolls!

Enhance your chances of carrying out a successful International Rescue Mission with this handsome two dice set, an essential accessory for Thunderbirds fans everywhere.
187321.name: Thunderbirds: D6 Dice Set

187323.name: G
187323.description:
User summary:

G is a solitaire RPG about space and loneliness. The game is played over fifty-two turns. Each turn presents a random event determined by flipping a card from a stripped pack. The player then responds to the event by "creating something". Characters have three Gauges (Traits): Sanity, Health, and Happiness. All Gauges start at 10 and decrease from there, depending on events.

Create Something is a term used for a game process of creating a video, writing a journal entry, writing a dream journal, or creating an audio log. These fifty-two "somethings" are archived and preserve the record of play.

187325.name: Rats in the Walls
187325.description:
From the introduction:

Rats in the Walls casts the players as "Rats in the Walls of Time," able to go back into the past and make changes to affect their present. Their reasons vary, but they are all driven by their hatreds, and it is their Hate which gives them the power to do so. They come from many disparate walks of life, but there are things within this world that they hate with such a passion that they are able to do the impossible. The only thing that connects them, aside from the ability itself, is the fact that they are conscious of the changes that others like them make.

187326.name: ReCoil
187326.description:
User summary:

ReCoil presents a unique and complex setting and highly peculiar mechanics. Players run Agents (characters) that attempt to salvage "reality" from being altered or damaged by supernatural forces (Naughtwraiths and others). Characters are not physical in nature, though they can enter into ("possess") physical beings if needed. Character creation is quite distinctive from a typical race/class/ability/skill system.

From the introduction:

Reality can be damaged by either side of the war. The Agents and the Naughtwraiths both have the limited ability to shape and change reality to their will. They are capable of incredible feats of strength and dexterity, above and beyond what is humanly possible. They can edit reality to their will, causing items to appear or disappear at will. This power, most especially for the Agents fighting to preserve reality, has a price, however; It introduces Flux, instability of belief and reality, which can lead to localized collapse of reality.

187329.description: Shin Satomi hakkenden (新里見八犬伝, literally "New Legend of the Eight Dogs of Satomi"), aka Eight Epics: Hakkenden, is a licensed version of Seiji Kanai's Eight Epics that draws on Toshio Kamata's 1982 novel of the same title – which was also the basis of Kadokawa's 1983 movie Legend of the Eight Samurai (里見八犬伝 Satomi hakkenden) – for its setting, with players trying to use the dice-manipulation powers of the eight characters in the game to chase away evil spirits.
187329.name: Eight Epics: Hakkenden

187331.name: Heat Up Live!
187331.description: In Heat Up Live!, you want your band to pump up a crowd and get them roaring — but which four band members will you choose out of the twelve available, and how will you use the abilities of the band members to best effect?

187332.name: モテるための１２の方法 (Twelve Ways to Charm)
187332.description: モテるための１２の方法 (Twelve Ways to Charm) is a set-collection game using colored and numbered cards.

187333.name: 寿司雀（Sushi-jong）
187333.description:
User summary

寿司雀 (Sushi Jong) is a simple set-collection card game, where people try to collect as many MahJong-styled sets of sushi as possible. Wasabi will ruin a sushi set, but a complete wasabi will increase the points. Bad Sushi can pollute most.

187334.name: Swan Date
187334.description:
The pond at Inokashira Park in Kichijoji is jinxed and has a famous phrase associated with it that (nearly) everyone knows: "A couple, if you ride in a boat, will break up."

You and your partner, however, had never heard this phrase before you entered a swan boat on the pond — but now that you have, you're wondering whether a break-up is inevitable. Work together in Swan Date to take pictures in the park, and perhaps you'll remain a couple by the time your boat reaches shore...

187336.description:
There are four kinds of people in our zombie world. Those who ran, and became zombies. Those who hid, and survived a little longer. Those who fought zombies, and became Survivors. And then come the Ultimate Survivors, heroes of this war of extinction!

Ultimate Survivors #2 features veteran Survivors, with their miniatures and ID Cards. Some Skills evolved to turn your heroes into war machines! All of them have a free additional Skill at Blue Level. So, they engage the Zombicide with two Skills instead of one!

Contents
- 8 Survivor miniatures and ID Cards
- 8 experience trackers

You need a Zombicide Season 1, Zombicide Season 2: Prison Outbreak, or Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue box to enjoy this expansion.
187336.name: Zombicide: Ultimate Survivors #2

187337.description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 3
Kampf X

Dein Kampfwert entspricht dem Grundwert deines stärksten Gegners.

Movement 3
Fight X

Your fight value is the basic fight value of your strongest enemy.
187337.name: Schäferstündchen: Das tapfere Schneiderlein

187339.name: Schäferstündchen: Der Holzfäller
187339.description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 3
Kampf 4

Du kannst nur eine Vergabekarte erhalten.

Movement 3
Fight 4

You can only receive one Allocation Card.

187340.description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 6
Kampf 2

Du darfst nur 4 Handkarten haben.

Movement 6
Fight 2

Your max. handsize is 4 cards.
187340.name: Schäferstündchen: Riese Rübezahl

187341.name: Beast: the Primordial
187341.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are one of the Begotten, the living embodiment of a primal nightmare of humanity. The World of Darkness is your home, and all of its myriad terrors and secrets are kin to you. Your Soul is a monstrous creature - maybe something that humanity dreamed and wrote down and still speaks of in legends, or maybe some outlandish horror that no living person has ever seen.

You are a Beast, and you must feed. Your Hunger drives you, and your Hunger might damn you. Indulge too lightly and your Soul will take matters into its own hands, roaming the Primordial Dream for sustenance and awakening murderous hatred in spiritually weak individuals. Feed too deeply and too often, and you become sluggish, sacrificing the raw edge of Hunger for the languor of Satiety. You must decide how to grow your Legend - will you be the monster incarnate, the thing that all other monsters fear? Or are you doomed to die under a Hero's sword?

This book contains:

The complete guide to playing a Beast in the World of Darkness
A game system designed to crossover with the other World of Darkness lines
A look at Beasts and their broods all around the world, from Vancouver to Tokyo
Rules for Heroes, the deluded individuals who think that this is their story

187342.name: Kettlespit
187342.description:
From publisher blurb:

Filbar Friday presents Kettlespit one of the major cities in my 5th edition campaign! Home to a variety of merchants, malcontents, and adventures this city has something for everyone. A group favorite for one-shot adventures my players all enjoy a visit to this city located in the Principality of Lockerbie. This city has a both generalized encounters and open challenges for any numbers of players. The open challenges (City adventure hooks) have been left to assign challenge ratings depending upon the characters encountering the issue. The vast sprawl of the city gives the players a multitude of businesses to shop in but gives the DM the flexibility to make it “fit” their campaign. I hope your characters enjoy Kettlespit as much as mine do!

This adventure setting was designed for the 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level adventurer(s) and DM. This adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign.

187343.name: Vessels of the Void: Spaceships
187343.description:
From publisher blurb:

Out in the Dark

“Space was background noise to most people these days. No one really thought about the vast spaces in between, other than as time stuck inside a metal can.

Marcus could never get over it. The vastness of the void presented infinite possibilities. Some of those possibilities were inspiring. Some, as he knew, were terrifying.

He stared out the porthole, drinking in the black nothing. He watched for stars that seemed to blink out for an instant – a sign that the thing had returned. This odd ritual had become habit, though deep inside Marcus knew that it was forever gone.”

Vessels of the Void: Spaceships:

Provides details on operating spacecraft, including drive systems, life on-board, travel times, and communications delays.
Introduces rules to help you purchase and customize your own spaceship, and keep it repaired and resupplied.
Provides game statistics for eleven different spaceships, from simple orbital transfer vehicles to military ships to giant mining vessels.
Provides new rules for Modules and Sub-Modules, which customize and specialize your ship.
Introduces both narrative and tactical space combat systems, for both small and large altercations.

187344.name: 3 Fiendish Funnel Starters
187344.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three new frightening Funnel Starters by Mark Tygart, perfect for kicking off a Halloween session of Funnel World!

187345.name: The Price of Evil
187345.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Price of Evil is a haunted house toolkit that allows you to make a haunted house in about half an hour with a deck of cards, an hour if its your first time.

Note: Currently the layout is unfinished, the art is not yet present, and there needs to be some copy editing, but Halloween is coming up and so this is being offered in rough format. As it is cleaned up, the file will be updated with cleaner layout and art.

187346.name: Race to Starport, Parts 1-6
187346.description:
From the introduction:

In this adventure the player characters discover a new threat, face strange beings banished to the stars in a previous age, and must race to stop a portal being created that will bring more monsters into the Dragon Empire.

This adventure is split into six two-hour sessions, for a total of 12 hours run-time. The adventure is designed for characters of levels 1 to 4.

User summary:

This adventure is the first release for season 2 of the 13th Age organized play program.

187347.name: No Honor Among Thieves
187347.description:
No Honor Among Thieves is a competitive/cooperative game for three to six players, in which each player assembles a crew of thieves and sets out to see who can steal the most from the rich and powerful of the kingdom.

Each player is the head of their own crew, which consists of different character cards recruited from an array of thieves available for hire. These characters are then sent on heists to try and overcome defense cards in front of objectives, using their different sets of skills to bypass guards, traps and walls to get to the filthy lucre that they're after. Players not involved in the heist will, of course, try and stop the thieves in their tracks by playing Scheme cards, which represent the quirks of fate which might cause a heist to fail--unexpectedly alert guards, City Watch patrols, or the simple mistake that leads to disaster.

Staging a heist alone is difficult, but working together with other players leaves you open to betrayal by your so-called allies, or gives you the chance to betray them, and take it all for yourself. Once any player has been betrayed, the game changes, and more dangerous abilities on different cards can now be played. The Assassin begins killing other characters, the Pickpocket starts stealing from players, the Fall Guy takes the blame, and the whole table becomes a little more vicious. Thieves like to believe they have a code of honor, but once that illusion is broken, there is no going back.

What will you risk to be the richest and cleverest thief in this city of rogues?

187348.name: The Mysteries of Hollowfield

rpgseries.33734: Campaign Kits: Fantasy Adventure Plot Points

187348.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is here and Fat Goblin Games is out to scare the pants off of your players! Campaign Kits – The Mysteries of Hollowfield has eight spooky adventures in a sandbox town ready for you to drop into virtually any campaign setting. The Goblin Hoarde of John Bennett, Kalyna Conrad, J Gray, Garrett Guillotte, Rick Hershey, Kiel Howell, Jennifer R. Povey and Matt Roth have teamed up to not only bring you exciting adventures but something worthy of your campaign.

Hollowfield awaits. Are you ready?

Campaign Kits: Fantasy Adventure Plot Points is a product line that provides short adventure plots to help aid in filling your campaigns downtime. Each Plot Point provides enough details for you to quickly drop them in your game and are perfect for creating a series of exciting side stories.

187349.name: Warning!Signs
187349.description:
In this party game, players are all tourists, or strangers in a strange land. They come across signs, and must decipher their meaning. Players are dealt three Sign cards, and at the start of each turn, a Where card is drawn (depicting a location). Each turn, one player will act as the Tour Guide, and choose a Sign card to play with the Where card. All other players write a Caption for the Sign based on the Where. The Tour Guide collects all of the Captions, and after reading all of them aloud, will select the "best" one.
Captions are funny, outrageous, completely irreverent, or an earnest attempt to give the sign appropriate meaning.
Each time a Tour Guide picks your Caption, you win a Sign card. The first player to get 5 cards wins!

187350.description:
The Mystigo Game Kit is a party pack designed to be played by any group of people easily at any social occasion. The games are all extremely fast and easy to learn and teach, while at the same time being strategical enough to enjoy time and again. The Kit includes four stand alone card games diverse in themes and tactics, so there's a game to appeal to any group. Do you want to build the world's greatest art collection, or create strange creatures in a crazy genetics lab? Perhaps you prefer to throw a cow into a tornado or send drunken dwarves down the mine to fetch you glittering gemstones? Make your choice, teach the game in moments, and play!

The Mystigo Games Kit includes:

The Gallerist: Bid against other players to acquire the best collection at the most expensive art auction of the century.

60 Dwarves: The race is on to hire the best dwarves and send them into the treacherous mine for valuable gems.

Trust Me!: A classic European bluff-tastic card game is made more colorful and crazy, with new mechanics and cards introduced into the mix.

Dr Blender's Lab: Dr Blender has mixed up the body parts of the strange creatures in his genetics lab, and it's up to you to put them back together.
187350.name: Mystigo Games Kit

187351.description:
Alternate Art promo card for DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League card #92 The Joker: Clown Prince of Crime.

Obtainable only as a prize from attending WizKids Organized Play event - Rainbow Draft Weekend.

boardgameaccessory.138649: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League

187351.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League – The Joker: Clown Prince of Crime Alternate Art Promo

187352.name: Six-Gun Showdown
187352.description:
From the publisher's website:
Parsely #8: Six-Gun Showdown is the eighth game in the Parsely series. "You’re fresh out of the drunk tank, down to a pair of worn leather boots and whatever’s left in your pockets."

The disgraced former sheriff of a one-horse town embarks on a mission of revenge and redemption in this Wild West Parsely Game. Bar brawls, rattlesnakes, abandoned gold mines and gunslingers await!

Six-Gun Showdown comes with a map and game guide.

It’s recommended (but not necessary) to also have Parsely #1: Action Castle to play.

Difficulty Level: Beginner to Experienced

boardgameintegration.198619: DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash

187353.description:
Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

WizKids has announced a Civil War set for its popular Marvel Dice Masters Collectible Dice Game. Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War will include Starter Sets, Foil Packs, a Team Box, a Collector’s Box, a Playmat, and a Dice Bag. Release is planned for May.

Based on the Marvel comic book Civil War storyline, the set will include iconic characters from both sides of the conflict, like Spider-Man, Captain America, and Iron Man. It will also introduce new mechanics for the game: Thunderbolts, Enlistment, and New Warriors.
187353.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War

boardgameaccessory.223646: Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War – Captain Marvel: Captain Carol Danvers Alternate Art Promo

187354.description:
Promotional Figure and card for the Krosmaster: Arena game.

He has the Ogre trait. His attack costs 5 action points to deal 1 damage to multiple targets.

At the end of his turn, he heals all his life points if he didn't deal any damage this turn.

The flavor quote is:
"One should not be afraid of animals while talking about Ogrest. When he was a kid, the ogre was already into monkey business and eating like a horse. His feelings for Dathura grew him lion-hearted, but he would fight like cats and dogs for her. When she disappeared, his teardrops flooded the world; for sure these were no crocodile tears... Too late to cry wolf!"
187354.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Young Ogrest

187355.description:
A promo figure and card for Krosmaster: Arena.

Darkli Moon has the Wild and Shadow Traits.

His attack is "Hammer Launch" for 5 action points dealing 2 damage in a hammer area of effect, then retreats 1 cell.

He has the power of "Shadow of the Jungle" which activates the first time a level 2 or higher "Wild" ally is KOed, he treats that Krosmaster as if it were 2 levels lower to a minimum of 1.

Flavor:
"That's no moon...
Every moon has a dark side. Even the cutie, hammer-wielding money god! Being a divine shadow has it's perks, like being able to wander on it's own and receive copious amounts of bananas in sacrifice. Kanniballs even worship him as the dark, fury protector of the island. Yet he is cursed to forever be overshadowed by another more famous monkey..."
187355.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Darkli Moon

187356.description:
A promo figure and card for Krosmaster: Arena. He is a playable character.

His flavor text reads:

"Thunder-Bubble! Is your town assailed by Evil? Call Arty! He'll transform into a giant dragon and send Evil back home to its mama! But don't summon him if you particularly fond of your buildings - he has a tendency to break a lot of things while fighting..."

His power is "Bububble" - Arty and the allied Krosmasters adjacent to him gain "Unfazed" during the adverse player's turns.
187356.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Arty

187357.description:
A promo for Krosmaster: Arena. This is one of the hardest to get promos, as it is only awarded to players who beat a representative from the company, who runs this overpowered character against you.

This mighty character is a veritable war machine! He can use his power-infused sword to massacre adventurers in their dozens! There's a reason his sword is known as the "plight-saber"... Nobody knows his true intentions, but it's said that, just before slaughtering his enemies, he tells them: "Hasta la vista, Bilby! I'll be back..."
187357.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Goldenrod Terminatot

187358.name: Unholy Champions of the Demon Lord
187358.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unholy Champions of the Demon Lord reveals six vile demons conjured from the imaginations of six talented supporters of the Shadow of the Demon Lord Kickstarter campaign. Each demon acts as the seed for an entire campaign, a terrifying monstrosity with which you can test the mettle of your groups in the last days of a dying world.

187359.name: Gute Fahrt
187359.description: Each player plays with one or two cars. Movement is determined with a die (3, 4, 5) and a color die (red, yellow, green). The two playing boards fit together to form a large City map. The players have to visit the spaces listed on the card or cards of their color. The first player to reach his final destination wins the game.

187360.name: Neo-Hunt 2
187360.description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt 2 is a round-based board and card game for 3-6 players. Each player controls a single "varan" (a bio-engineered humanoid reptile). The goal of the game is to kill other players' "varan" and to eliminate "trooper" units (game tokens). Play continues until only one "varan" remains or until all "trooper" units are destroyed. If multiple "varan" units remain then scores are tallied to determine the winner.

Setup:

The game board is randomly created by assembling it from hexagonal sector tiles. Players are given one random "varan" card and one "trooper" card; "varan" units are initially deployed in a hidden state. "Trooper" units are then places sequentially on the board. Players then draw a full hand of action cards and play begins.

Game Play:

Play proceeds in "rounds" during which each player gets a turn. Each player's "varan" can make an attack upon a unit it can see, either "varan" or "trooper". Successful attacks deal damage (which may be insufficient to remove a unit). Destroyed units are removed and scored. Players also draw special cards and may play them, taking whatever action is described. After the players have moved all "trooper" units then move or fire at visible "varan" units following a basic rule.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

187361.name: Neo-Hunt
187361.description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt is a board game about highly advanced cyber varans (large humanoid reptilians) in special testing zone or battleground. Their mission is simple: destroy as many trooper units or other varans as possible before being destroyed or until there are no more troopers left

Setup:

Players select a "varan" token and a corresponding "order" card. All the "order" cards for players are combined with one gray "trooper" order card; this deck is shuffled to determine phase order. "Trooper" cards are randomly selected to make a trooper deck; 7-17 cards may be used (this will determine approximate game length). "Sector Tiles" are then shuffled and randomly distributed into a circle form to create a random playing board. Players then receive a random "varan" card and eleven "action" cards.

Game Play:

Play continues until all "troopers" are destroyed. If a player's "varan" is destroyed they can resume with new "varan" but will suffer a score penalty. On each player's turn they utilize action cards and move their varan into a new sector or attack any other unit they see. On the trooper turn standard rules apply to move or shoot; troopers will only shoot at visible varans. The game supports a few special status conditions which may occur.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

187362.description:
The Epic Geek edition was intended to celebrate the 10th anniversary of Wits & Wagers, but it needed another year to get "that extra kick over the cliff" (yes, this version goes to 11). There are 3 things which make the Epic Geek edition different (and better) than every other edition of Wits & Wagers:

1) It has all new questions about the epic stories we love such as Star Wars, The Avengers, Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, The Matrix, Monty Python, Batman, etc. If there is a brand you love, chances are you'll find a question or two about it in this game.

2) It has stunning artwork on the back of each HUGE 5" x 8" player board. These illustrations were commissioned by some of the best artists in the industry such as Boris Vallejo & Julie Bell, Jimmy Palmiotti & Amanda Connor , and Jon Kovalic.

3) Every player board comes with an unique in-game power that adds a layer of fun interaction to the game. Anytime the zombie player goes all-in and loses, he comes back to life with 5 free chips. The Wizard of Odds can switch any two payout odds before the answers are revealed. The Superhero helps the downtrodden by moving another player's bet to the correct answer (for which he receives a small token of gratitude from the mayor). You get the idea! It’s the interaction of these thematic in-game powers that make this edition epically fun to play.
187362.name: Wits & Wagers: Epic Geek Edition

187363.name: Dinosaur King (2005)
187363.description:
