Dinosaur King is a card-based arcade game from Sega that uses the same gameplay mechanics from Mushiking but uses super-powered dinosaurs instead of beetles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dinosaur King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

187364.name: Dinosaur King (2008)
187364.description:
The game's story is about Max, Rex, and Zoe, the members of the D-Team (of whom only Max and Rex are available as player characters). One day, they find mysterious stones that allow them to summon dinosaurs, after creating special cards from fossils, using a special device called a Dinoshot. However, an evil group called the Alpha Gang steals a Dinoshot in order to create a dinosaur empire. It is the D-Team's job to stop the Alpha Gang.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dinosaur King (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

187366.description:
A special map for playing Catan in India.

The game follows the usual Settlers of Catan rules with three major differences:


Settlements and roads may only be built on marked spaces
Victory point chits are put on some crossing points marked on the map; they are claimed by the first player who builds a road there
Special Rickshaw Run streets which give additonal victory points
187366.name: Catan Länderszenarien: Rickshaw Run

187367.name: Realms of Adventure
187367.description:
From the introduction:

Realms of Adventure is a fantasy role playing game that allows you to play any type of character you wish without any artificial or arbitrary limitations. The system emphasizes role playing over rules and helps to create a world of wonder and excitement instead of just dice rolling!

Players and GMs will find ecerything they need to create wondrous characters and adventures. Here is a system that rewards creativity and gives you the freedom to go where you want to go while giving you the guidelines to make the game fun, fair, and exciting!

When you enter the Realms of Adventure the only limits are your imagination!

User summary:

The 3rd Edition of the game (this item) is entitled Realms of Adventure. The 1st and 2nd Editions of the game were entitled Lands of Adventure.

187368.description:
Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men card #129 Black Widow: Tsarina.

Obtainable only as a prize from attending/winning official WizKids tournaments.

boardgameaccessory.148575: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men

187368.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men – Black Widow: Tsarina Alternate Art Promo

187369.description:
The Royal Golfing Association were heavily criticised after the 'Augustus' campaign for promoting golf as an elitist sport. Many argued that golf should be available to all, not just those who could afford top flight membership fees. Bowing to this pressure the RGA have launched the 'Municipal Golf Club' initiative and challenge local authorities and councils to redevelop their suburban and brown field sites in a competition to design and build the best golf course that will be accessible to all members of the public.

As Chairman of your local council parks and recreation department, you must do all you can to secure this coveted prize for your borough. However with your neighbouring districts equally driven to win, you might have to resort to underhand tactics to sabotage the opposition's plans. Perhaps by the construction of a disruptive by pass through their course or even funding a sewage treatment facility a bit too close to a fairway. Perhaps the winner may not be decided by which course is the best, but which is the least worst!

Eighteen new 'urban' course cards to be spliced into the original deck. New Market and Club House cards along with special cards focused on making the design of your opponents courses as difficult as possible. Not to mention those dastardly fly tippers dumping rubbish all over your lovely fairways! This second expansion for The Front Nine requires a more ruthless attitude for the prospective golf course designer. Not for the faint hearted!
187369.name: The Front Nine: The Municipal Golf Club

187370.name: Realms of Adventure: Fantasy (LARP)
187370.description:
User summary:

Realms of Adventure: Fantasy (LARP), the official rule book, is provided online as a FLASH presentation that allows viewers to hyperlink to specific topics or to thumb through page-by-page. The book also can be downloaded as a traditional PDF. Finally, the book text (without illustrations) is almost entirely reproduced in online HTML pages, organized by topic. The book has very high production values, excellent layout, and is richly illustrated with color photographs of past events.

The rules cover character creation (background, race, class, skills), magic (arcane, bardic, divine, runic, shamanic), special skills (alchemy, poison craft, stealth, locks, traps), and combat. The game uses "boffer" style combat with armor, shields, and weapons. The rule book includes good instruction on how to manufacture safer boffer weapons, including arrows, and also on spell packets. A special section is devoted to orientation for new players.

187371.name: The World of Adraveth
187371.description:
User summary:

The World of Adraveth is the setting used for Realms of Adventure: Fantasy Live-Action Role-Play. While much of the setting is of course generated by actual play, a common basis is presented as a series of HTML pages and a large, zooming color map. The major sections include: Overview, Lands of Adraveth, Laws of the Land, Trade & Commerce, and Keeping Track of Time. More of the setting is retained privately for discovery through actual play.

Note that additional setting details (especially regarding deities and religion) is presented in the rule book.

187372.name: Agar.io
187372.description:
Agar.io is a massively multiplayer action game developed by Matheus Valadares. Players control a cell in a map representing a petri dish; the goal is to gain as much mass as possible by swallowing smaller cells without being swallowed by bigger ones. The name Agar.io comes from the substance agar, used to culture bacteria.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agar.io Agar.io]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

187373.name: Megalomania
187373.description:
Megalomania is a card-centric base-building game in which players take the role of megalomaniacs. The flavor of the game is a mixture of James Bond and Looney Tunes villains, focusing on ridiculous scheming rather than sinister.

Game-play is accomplished in turns, with each player possessing two actions. Players may build structures, hire minions, develop schemes and attack other players. Most cards synergize with others, granting bonuses for building intelligently and towards particular strategies.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to score twelve infamy. Infamy is generated by completing plots - which require resources - and assaults - which require greater attack than an opponent has defense.

187374.name: Red Ash World Engine
187374.description:
User summary:

Characters belong to one of eighteen named races; this determines some future development options. Characters in Red Ash World Engine have numerous "variables". The first set are ten Abilities with numeric Scores. Additionally, characters have Size, Weight, Encumbrance, Status, Effects, Traits, and Skills. Magic is handled as a Skill. Characters enter into a Class with a predefined level progression. Levels run from 1 to 100; training is required to increase Level (to "level up") from Levels 2 to 50, thereafter characters are considered masters of the Class. The system presents sixteen classes, half of which are restricted to specific races.

Combat is complex and supports numerous routine and special actions and circumstances, as well as terrain features and facing. Actions during combat are controlled by impulse point allocation--when an actor is out of points they cannot further act in the round. Armor does not offer protection from being hit, but does absorb damage from any hits.

The rules (text) are released under a creative commons license. The site also offers several javascript play utilities, including: Creation Points Calculator; Experience Calculator; and Dice Roller. Note the presentation as HTML-only, with numerous drop-down selection boxes for individual elements, etc., makes use cumbersome (this is partially ameliorated by the Site Menu).

187375.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 8 - Feb 1976)
187375.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 8

Original Version published 8 Feb 1976 (100 copies)
- Had an insert advertisement for Cosmic Frog Publications
Reprinted Version published Oct 1976
PDF Reprinted Version published Oct 2015

The reprinted version was re-typed and thus was several pages shorter than the original (formatting varied, not contents).

187377.description:
Each turn in Vikings Gone Wild — a deck-building, resource management game based on the online real-time strategy game — players can either buy permanent buildings sitting in front of them (resource factories, resources containers, etc) or buy units, towers and special cards that improve their deck and offense/defense capacity.

The only way to win is by successfully attacking each other, and each attack involves interesting bluffing mechanisms in which the attacker doesn't know the defense capacity of their opponent...
187377.name: Vikings Gone Wild

187378.name: Candy Grab
187378.description:
A fast-paced easy to learn card game where you grab everyone else's candy before they get yours.
Get ready for Candy Grab. It’s easy to play, fun for everyone, and totally addictive! Be the last player with any candy cards left in your candy pile by grabbing and eating the other players' candy. Watch out! The other players may make you eat your own candy instead! It is a great family game with plenty of opportunities for any player to go from no candy, to lots of candy in a single hand. When it comes to a fun game for the whole family, Candy Grab is a must have game that provides hours of entertainment for all!

187379.name: Infinite Space III: Sea of Stars
187379.description:
User Description by zefquaavius

Infinite Space III: Sea of Stars is to Weird Worlds: Return to Infinite Space as Weird Worlds is to Strange Adventures in Infinite Space: A reimagining of the game system, upgraded, modernized, and fleshed out with still more weird things to discover… and kill you. Explore space; trade, buy, and sell items; encounter intelligent and belligerent species, all on borrowed time and money. As with its predecessors, combat is real-time and tactical, while everything else in the game is "turn-based", but with all actions being measured in days. Furthermore, the series tradition of short gameplay continues; however, the trend of the game sessions taking longer also continues; so, rather than a typical game being the 15 minutes of Strange Adventures, or the 45 minutes of Weird Worlds in its longer play modes, the shortest play mode of Sea of Stars takes about 60 minutes. The biggest difference from its predecessors, visible right out of the gate, is the fully 3D navigation and ship models (the combat is still locked to a 2D plane, though).

Funding for this game's development was crowdsourced through Kickstarter.

187380.name: Galileo Uplift
187380.description:
To fight aliens, one must use the alien. Take it apart, reverse-engineer it, rebuild it, turn it into armor and sensors and weapons and aircraft good enough to win a war against an enemy from the stars. Tech and gear for your high-powered MOON DUST MEN game, powered by a new GUMSHOE “tech tree” subystem for bootstrapping invention and development.

- Publisher's description

187382.name: Super HOO HA!
187382.description:
The game uses a pack of 81 cards consisting of one Super HOO HA! card, 24 red "answer" cards and 4 suits each of 14 cards of a particular colour. Each suit consists of one HOO, one HA! and 12 "question" cards of the form "40+8"and "2x8".
Seven cards are dealt to each player, one is turned face up and the rest put face down as a draw deck.
On their turn a player should can do one of five things depending on the top card of the discard pile.
1) Play another question card of the same colour as the top card
2) Play a question card that has the same answer
3) Play correct answer
4) Play a question card that matches the answer
5) Play any HOO HA! or Super HOO HA! card
If they can do none of these they pass.
Each of the above plays has an effect, e.g. next player misses their turn.
When one player gets rid of all their cards the rest of the players add up the values of their unplayed cards and a running total is kept. The winner is the last player to reach 215.
The Super HOO HA! game consists of three 81 card packs, based on the numbrs 8, 12 and 14 respectively and only one pack is used in any one game.

187383.description:
In Bigfoot vs. Yeti you are an up and coming cryptozoologist mounting expeditions in the hopes of proving the existence of unknown creatures such as Bigfoot, Yeti, The Loch Ness Monster, the Jersey Devil or Extraterrestrials. Your ultimate goal is to gain fame and fortune by being the first cryptozoologist credited with the actual discovery of a new species, making you world famous.

As a cryptozoologist you of course have an opinion on who the king of the cryptids is. Some of you say it's Bigfoot and others of you claim it's the Yeti. Choose your side as it will help shape the fate of your research and ultimately your success!

During each turn players draw from either the Unknown (draw pile) or from the top of Tabloids (discard pile). Each player creates or adds to melds using Expedition cards in order to reach ten or more points. If ten or greater points is achieved that expedition would be considered to have found enough proof for science to take notice, thereby doubling that set's score. Also during each turn a single Anomaly card (action card) may be played which can do things like strengthen the value of an expedition in play, retrieve cards from the Tabloids, discredit other players expeditions or manipulate other facets of the game. At the end of a round, cards in the Tabloids that match expeditions in play discredit that expedition.

The game also has a shut-out rule involving Extraterrestrials that, if achieved, prevents all other players from scoring that round.
187383.name: Bigfoot vs. Yeti

187384.name: All Tricks, No Treats
187384.description:
In All Tricks, No Treats you and your friends, brothers and sisters plus that one annoying neighborhood kid that always tags along have just finished divvying all of the good candy and you are down to those last terrible "treats". Stuff like pretzels, toothbrushes, stale candy corn and the dreaded rock. You want to get as little of that junk as possible!

All Tricks, No Treats is an abstract card laying game for two to four weary trick or treaters. Players take turns placing "treats" cards in a way to minimize the crappy "treats" they will get stuck with which is determined by one of the cards they have selected from their hands and not placed.

187385.name: Besiege
187385.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Besiege is an upcoming physics based building game in which you construct medieval siege engines and lay waste to immense fortresses and peaceful hamlets. Build a machine which can crush windmills, wipe out battalions of brave soldiers and transport valuable resources, defending your creation against cannons, archers and whatever else the desperate enemies have at their disposal. Create a trundling behemoth, or take clumsily to the skies, and cause carnage in fully destructible environments.
Ultimately, you must conquer every Kingdom by crippling their castles and killing their men and livestock, in as creative or clinical a manner as possible!

Source: The Game Website.

187386.name: The Return of the Things that go Crash in the Night
187386.description:
From publisher blurb:

See two One Big Monster (OBM) horrors of 1st Edition re-imagined for use in 2nd Edition play!

The Chainsaw Maniac

Now with upgrades for twisted cohorts of terrifying sculpted flesh!

The Butcher

Containing rules not only for this fearsome opponent, but for his house of horrors called simply "The Slaughterhouse"

187387.name: Take a Chance
187387.description:
From publisher blurb:

No Job Is Easy

No matter what Mr. Johnson says, shadowrunners are never hired to do anything easy. If the job were easy, Mr. Johnson would do it himself. Sharp shadowrunners learn to recognize when a job is going to present extra challenges. There are certain signs, such as: 1) Mr. Johnson is openly auditioning multiple teams, both to find the right people and to set the auditioning parties on edge. 2) Mr. Johnson doesn’t seem too anxious to reveal relevant details of the job; and worst of all, 3) Mr. Johnson claims it will be easy.

Sarah Silverleaf has a job for the runners, but unfortunately all of the above criteria are met. Danger is waiting for the runners, and she’s not about to tell them what it is. They’ll have to walk in the dark, navigate the unknown, and survive whatever comes at them. Because that’s the job.

Take a Chance is the conclusion of the fifth season of Shadowrun Missions, but it’s not the end of the runners’ time in Chicago. More intrigue awaits—if the runners can survive Silverleaf’s mission.

Take a Chance is a great continuation of the season-long plotline for Missions, or an exciting space to launch a campaign. It is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

187388.name: Cthulhu Apocalypse
187388.description:
From publisher blurb:

On November 2nd, 1936, the world died.

Finally, the stars had come right; and things that lurked under the seas for eons rose to claim their rightful place. Now, they rule the earth, stalking it like titans.

Millions of women and men died—yet you survived, doomed to wander the ruins, searching for answers. What went wrong? Are there others like you? How can you stay alive? And is there a way to put this right?

Cthulhu Apocalypse is a survival horror supplement for the Trail of Cthulhu roleplaying game that takes Investigators into a terrifying post-apocalyptic world.

Using the award-winning Apocalypse Machine, GMs can destroy the world any number of ways — including the death rays of alien tripods, a plague of white flowers, or the rising of Great Old Ones — and run adventures of investigation and survival in a land transformed beyond recognition.

Cthulhu Apocalypse includes:

The Apocalypse Machine, an award-winning GUMSHOE sandbox setting that gives you the tools to create your own global catastrophe — from the first strange rumblings to the final, cataclysmic event — along with Drives, Occupations, and more for adventures among the ruins.
Five adventures in the aftermath of disaster, taking Investigators through Britain, across the sea to America, and beyond the veils of reality as they struggle to survive. (Previously published as The Dead White World.)
Three adventures set years later, as the few survivors find their humanity cracking and moulting in the process of becoming something new. (Previously published as Slaves of the Mother.)
Eight all-new scenarios that give your players the choice as to whether — and how — humanity survives in this strange new world.

187389.name: Tournament of Fate
187389.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something is sealed away. Something horrible. To keep it out of the world, a magical ritual takes place every sixty years to strengthen the bonds on the Great Beast.

Five artifacts of power take shape within the world and are sought out as the means to complete the ritual needed to maintain the prison. The one who completes the ritual gets a boon of great power such that it could grant them dominion over nations or even immortality.

As a result, every sixty years, the effort to seal the beast devolves into a war of supernatural power which has been called the Tournament of Fate.

This is a Myth Arc for use with the Monster of the Week game written by Michael Sands from Generic Games and revised and published by Evil Hat.

Included are:

Five sample artifacts each with its own bizarre power.
Four monsters which can be used as rival seekers of the artifacts or used for their own scenarios in your own campaign.
Rules for fighting the Great Beast should the Heroes fail to prevent its release.
Rules to run the final conflict of the five wielders as a one-shot scenario.

187390.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume IV
187390.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the freemage, an arcanist archetype for those who believe that magic should not serve the caster, but rather be allowed to act freely and anarchically, and who can gamble their magical power when casting spells, or turn their enemies' magic against them, the order of the broken tower, a cavalier order devoted to protecting the common folk against oppressive tyrants, who specializes in guerilla tactics and serves as an inspiration for rebellions, the green wilds rebel, a druid archetype for those who believe that nature should rise up and throw off the yoke of civilization, which can turn plants and animals against mankind, and is resistant to the lures of civilization, the revolutionary bloodline, for sorcerers born from revolution, which has a mix of powers allowing them to inspire others, and cause great damage with fires, and finally the martyrbond revolutionary, a spiritualist archetype for spiritualists whose phantoms were martyred in life, and who fight alongside their phantom to continue that rebellion.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

187391.name: Masters of the Tourist Trophy
187391.description:
Masters of the Tourist Trophy is a motorcycle racing sports replay game simulating the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy. The Isle of Man TT has, for many years, been regarded as the most prestigious and oldest motorcycle race in the world... and also the most dangerous motorcycle road-race in the world!

Summary

The game is typical of Lambourne's sports replay simulations in that it takes place on tables and charts (no board or counters) with minimal player decisions required.

The simulation has been developed to capture the confused progress of the Isle of Man mountain bike races. With drivers setting off at different times, the system is able to record both the positions on the course from a spectator viewpoint as well as keep track of the actual driver times for determining a race winner. As in the actual Tourist Trophy, crashes and mishaps are common and not all riders can be expected to finish.

The game includes race control sheets for six different classes of race, from the ultra-lightweight 125cc bikes to the Formula One 1200cc monsters. The famous TT sidecars are also represented in a class of their own.

The drivers represented and rated are drawn from the "all-time greats" from over 100 years of Tourist Trophy events.

Brief outline of the Game System

The race is set up on a Race Control Sheet that lists Driver Name, Driver Rating and Start Time. For each stage of the race every driver rolls two pairs of dice (red and green) to advance their progress.

The difference between the green "+" and red "-" dice, when added to the driver performance rating, determine whether the driver performance improves or degrades on each stage of the lap. Comparison of the driver performance ratings will reveal the order of the drivers on the circuit as they pass each checkpoint on the circuit.

Rolling doubles on either pair of dice may improve or degrade the driver performance rating, but rolling double "6" requires a further roll on Rider Mistakes or Mechanical Trouble charts. Such problems usually result in a performance loss, but can also cause retirement through a crash or serious mechanical failure. Game charts will determine the precise location of each such accident on the circuit.

Drivers must also elect to Pit Stop at least once during the race. This can be dome at a time decided by the player and requires a die roll and chart reference to determine the effect the pit stop has on race time.

At the end of the lap the cumulative performance for each of the four lap stages can be cross-referenced against the game charts to determine the lap time and average speed for each driver on the circuit.

187392.name: The Tar Pits
187392.description:
From publisher blurb:

The road from the mine has always been a treacherous one. The scholars say that the sticky black tar that bubbles from the ground is linked to the black firestone that the miners delve for, but that's never concerned Old Gret. His mind is set on watching his footing as he crosses another rickety bridge. He doesn't want to end up like those behemoths beneath him, their bleached bones still stuck in the tar. He's so preoccupied, he doesn't notice some of the bones begin to move...

Need a quick map for an encounter?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a rough road, interrupted by a set of large bubbling tar pits. Rickety wooden bridges cross the tar pits, with evidence of earlier bridges that collapsed into the sticky bitumen. The bleached bones of large animals are stuck in the tar - stark reminders of the dangers of crossing the Tar Pits. Near one of the bridges is a wrecked wagon - the contents of mined ore and stone spilling out, and spattered with worringly-fresh blood.

187393.description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that can be added on third position to any adventure.
187393.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Narkonna: Der vergessene Hafen

177079.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn

187394.name: Shadow
187394.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Blackest Night!

Mythic Monsters: Shadow brings you a dozen and one shadowy sneaks from the realms of endless nocturn. Whether lurking in the dark and hidden places beneath the ground or emerging from beshadowed realms far beyond this mortal coil, there is something terribly cool about creatures of raw and endless darkness. From the sleek and sinister unseelie realms to the coiling, roiling, pits of eternal night, creatures of shadow have always captured our imagination, whether they are simply misunderstood dwellers in darkness or truly villains of the deepest dye. From CR 3 to 25, we bring you the living and the dead that live beyond the light, from simple shadows seeking to blot out the light and drink your life to towering nightwalkers, the devastating heralds of annihilation. The secretive and stealthy dark creepers and dark stalkers lurk within these pages, alongside the misshapen umbral shepherds and the terrifying tenebrous worms that mature into beautiful but deadly gloomwings. A quartet of killer kytons are found, from the bloodthirsty lampadarius and the vivisecting interlocutor to the sinister sacristan and the horrid eremite lords of the kyton race. Finally, the umbral dragon graces these pages with its sleek shimmer-gloom, breathing darkness and devouring light. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the mysterious shadowpeople exist forever on the edge of sight, their motives as much an enigma as their true face and form. For heroes or villains wishing to tame the shadow, we also present a mythic version of the shadowdancer prestige class, with mythic versions of each and every class feature!

187395.name: Trio of Taverns (Pathfinder Edition)
187395.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trio of Taverns, the third installment in the Tangible Taverns line, features not one, but, you guessed it, three taverns. Give your players the chance to explore what happens when a capable barbarian known for beheading his opponents falls in love with jam making and settles down to open his own shop, or let your players try to seduce a city noble by taking her to the classiest and most romantic tavern in town, or just stick with the basics and let them dance the night away with great entertainment and delicious food, while avoiding the shadier elements.

This instalment of Tangible Taverns brings you three smaller scale taverns each with rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and a description of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for some tavern employees and patrons).

With all that, more original artwork than ever before, and "More Faces at the Tavern", featuring NPCs ready to be slotted into the tavern your PCs are visiting, you are all set to have some role-playing fun when your PCs stop off for a drink.

Like the troublesome mischievous creature we are named after, dire rugrat publishing delights in bringing a little excitement to what could have otherwise been a peaceful, though perhaps comparably dull evening at the local tavern. Our line of books, Tangible Taverns, is designed to bring life back to the much visited watering hole, a common setting while adventurers are on the road.

187396.name: The Witch's Fields
187396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween Fun for the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game!

This is an adventure for brand new characters - level 1-5.

The heroes arrive in the town of Redryn's Rest to answer the call for adventure! A clan of goblins has been attacking the town's outlying settlements and the town mayor is offering a huge reward. The characters arrive too late: the quest has already been awarded to rival band of adventurers.

Things escalate when the opposing adventurers’' foolish bravery unleashes an ancient, cruel fey menace on the peaceful lands.

Venture into the Witch's Fields, meet new monsters, colorful NPCs, and more all against the backdrop of a spooky Halloween-inspired adventure sure to give your players tricks and treats (but mostly tricks)!

Challenging Challenges

Our adventures are special because they're really tough but also really fair. This offering is scaled for lower level characters but they'll squirm when they face the dark fey and their bloodthirsty witch queen. Tough adventures are the ones you'll remember and hopefully that mean's you'll remember us!

187397.name: The Dying Flame
187397.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the 5th edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game!

This is an adventure setting for level 15-17 characters. It's a dungeon crawl into a mummy lord's tomb. What? A dungeon crawl for tier 3 characters? Yes!

Take a break from saving the world, blow the dust (or sand) off of your fifty feet of hemp rope, and check the tar on the end of your torches because evil is stiring under the sands.

This adventure location doesn't inclue a narative story, it's just a dungeon, but there are random events, traps, and a few hooks to stiminulate your imagination.

The module also includes stats for a host of advanced mummies to challenge high level characters (don't worry, they've been extensivley playtested for fairness and deadliness). What good is a dungeon delve without a reward? There're several cool magic items fit for your legendary heroes.

But best of all there's so many ways to die!

Burried in sand, crushed by golden ceilings, fed alive to swarms of demonic scarabs, or simply cursed to walk the halls of the mummy lord's tomb forever, searching for a way to finally extinguish the Dying Flame.

187398.name: Echo & Gauntlet
187398.description:
Publisher blurb:

Start with a nasty magical strike force that works for the Crusader. Continue in a supernatural landscape that speeds their magic. Finish with campaign hooks, the implications of a ruined world that exists alongside the world, and a possible origin story for the Crusader.

187399.name: Zero Escape: Time Dilemma

videogamehonor.38813: 2016 Golden Joystick Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

187399.description:
December 31, 2028. Nevada desert. Nine people have been living and performing experiments for the past five days in the Dcom facility. On the sixth day, they discover they are trapped in confinement rooms, an unfamiliar black bracelet strapped to their left wrists. A mysterious figure in a mask appears before them, demanding that they play the "Decision Game." "The lives of you, me, and the human race hang in the balance." Transported to a shelter underground, they are divided into 3 teams and left in separate wards. Which team will manage to stay alive...? The fate of all mankind rests on their decision!

Zero Time Dilemma is the third entry in the acclaimed Zero Escape series. The mysterious "Zero" traps 9 participants within an underground shelter, dividing them equally between 3 wards that are connected to an elevator shaft in the middle. The only way out – passing through a locked X-Door to access the elevator. Six passwords are required to unlock the door, and each password is revealed only after a participant dies. Zero's "Decision Game" will offer teams the opportunity to kill other participants through a variety of means to obtain the necessary passwords so they may escape.

Source: The Game Website.

187400.name: Boron-Vademecum
187400.description:
User summary

A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Boron, God of death and dreams. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cults of Boron.

187401.name: Secrets of the Chi War
187401.description:
From the PDF:

Factions of chi warriors battle through the Netherworld and across four junctures in time and space for dominance. Feng Shui sites, each one a nexus of world-changing power, topple and fall. Critical shifts unleash cross-time changes hitherto unknown to humanity. Terrible villains, ruthless dictators, conspiring agents, and abominations of unspeakable origin gather to fight for victory in this endless war.

Revealed here for the first time are new secrets of this tireless conflict, from battle zones in each juncture to pop-up junctures open only for a short time — long enough to serve as the front lines of the Chi War.

Expanding on material contained within the Feng Shui 2 core rulebook, Secrets of the Chi War unleashes even more potent lore for use in your games, including a full-length adventure set in Japan!

Visit the Ancient, Past, Modern, and Future Junctures, and learn the secrets of the Netherworld
Blow up Chang’an, Canton, Seoul, Tokyo, Ape City, the Gene Zone, or the Pagodas
Hurtle through the temporary Netherworld portals to the time of the warring states, the swinging 1960s, the funky 70s, the pastel-tinted 80s, or even the far distant past, where dinosaurs roam
Fight through the streets of Tokyo in the adventure The Lotus and the Poppy




Join contributors from across the game publishing industry in ushering in a new era... or relive eras now lost to history and the machinations of Chi Warriors past and present!

Join us in the Secrets of the Chi War!

187402.name: Hunt in the Dark
187402.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dirty Rotten Rats!

Weary and thirsty, your dig team arrives in the tiny village of Rust Haven just in time to save the day! Beasts have attacked the village and while the militia chases them off, Black Scavenger, an ambitious bipedal rat mercenary, has escaped from the jail. He and with his thugs fled into the ruins beneath the community! With Rust Haven’s best fighters out in the wastes, the people of the settlement need you to go into the ancient depths and bring the villain, Black Scavenger, to justice, dead or alive.

What horrors, curiosities and artifacts your team will find below the earth are unknown, but this is what you live for. You are excavators and post-apocalyptic heroes.

Hunt in the Dark is our 6th One Day Dig for The Mutant Epoch RPG and was written by Giulio Iannarella. In this 15 page Pay What You Want product is 1 full page player handout and 1 map, 25 illustrations, a mutant sub-species and two new relics.

187403.name: Werebats
187403.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Werebats is Ready to Fly into Your Game

Part human, part bat. It's Batm -- er, werebats!

Universally depicted as screeching denizens of the night sky, werebats would prefer the life of reclusive homebodies but sometimes find themselves forced into the moonlight to protect family and friends.

Bite Me! Werebats is a 19-page supplement describing a race of natural shapechangers at home in the air, under the ground, secretly in human cities, and especially at night -- the darker the better.

Bite Me! Werebats Contains:

Rules for creating werebat characters using the Bite Me! lycanthrope system, including new racial traits, archetypes, and feats.
New werebat spells (from caverncurse to summon riding bats), magic items (from a carrying net to the screamer's mask), and equipment (from bomber's harness to guano grenades) .
Details of werebat life and society.
Two completely statted (in both human and bat forms) ready-to-use NPCs.

boardgamecompilation.198628: Koffer zu und ab die Reise

187405.description:
A tile laying game with 62 cards.

Every card has 4 squares on it. Squares come in four colors.

Winner is the player who covers the smallest area laying out the cards delt to him on top of each other using matching color patterns.

Part of the Ravensburger Compact Serie
187405.name: Doublet

187407.name: Steamalot
187407.description:
User Summary

This card game plays out on a chess-like board with characters, items, and skills. Maximizing a character card's potential is crucial by supporting it with proper items and skills and bringing it into battle at the right time and against the right enemy. You must destroy the enemy army on the board and they must kill your commanding character. You win coins that can be cashed in for card packs. Cards can be levelled up or combined to make other, better cards. You form a deck of 20 cards and play on 42 maps against the AI, with easy or hard difficulty, or against another player.

187408.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 45 - May 1979)
187408.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 45
May 1979

Released as PDF in October, 2015

187409.name: Conn8
187409.description:
Conn8 is a 2-player abstract strategy game. The aim for each player is to connect their own colored sides on a board paved with octagons and squares.

On their turn players place:

one piece in an octagon, or
two pieces on two different squares.




On their first turn, the first player may only place a single piece in a square. After that, the normal rules apply.

187411.name: What's Inside?

rpgseries.28733: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs

187411.description:
User Summary:
A game where you play as humans whose souls have been trapped in magical constructs. As long as you have your soul, there is a chance of returning to your old life. But how long can you keep your humanity in a dying world where you are considered a monster?

187412.name: Red Shift Lite
187412.description:
User summary:

Red Shift Lite is a quick start / fast play document to introduce players to the full Red Shift game. Most of the document focuses on character creation.

In the game, players begin with Character Points which are spent to purchase things during (and after) character creation. Most games will play with 100-150 Character Points.

Characters first buy Scores in the fifteen Attributes and then select a Race which will limit or enable future options. Red Shift Lite supports only two races: Human and Rhyrha. Characters next select a Profession which is somewhat like a "light-weight" class. Professions have minimum Attribute requirements and also provide Skills, possible bonuses, and bonus equipment. Characters have Talents and Advantages, as well as Disadvantages. Some characters also have Psionics; some Professions require Psionic ability for entry. Combat utilizes a dice pool comparison to a target number and supports damage and other familiar aspects of role-playing games.

187413.name: Red Shift (2nd Edition)
187413.description:
From the introduction:

Red Shift is a complete science-fiction roleplaying game system. It uses the Destiny Engine, a game engine that is used for all of Grendel Roleplaying’s core games. This allows you to use the characters you create in many different settings. Red Shift is designed to be playable by those who have never played a roleplaying game before, and yet still have the complexity that experienced players desire.

The basic concept of Red Shift is that after approximately nine hundred years of exploration, colonization, and war, mankind has spread out into all of the star systems near Earth. The great colony ships set out to find new and better worlds than our poor Earth, and hopefully not to make the same mistake of destroying the ecosystem with pollution and war. Many of them were lost among the unforgiving stars.

User summary:

In the game, players begin with Character Points which are spent to purchase things during (and after) character creation. Most games will play with 100-150 Character Points.

Characters first buy Scores in the fifteen Attributes and then select a Race which will limit or enable future options. Red Shift Lite supports only two races: Human and Rhyrha. Characters next select a Profession which is somewhat like a "light-weight" class. Professions have minimum Attribute requirements and also provide Skills, possible bonuses, and bonus equipment. Characters have Talents and Advantages, as well as Disadvantages. Some characters also have Psionics; some Professions require Psionic ability for entry.

187414.name: Red Shift Equipment Guide
187414.description:
User summary:

The Red Shift Equipment Guide, 2nd Edition. Presents extensive equipment lists for Red Shift. Equipment is presented in functional groups with illustrations, descriptions, and technical data to support game play. Much of the equipment is of a "high tech" (science fiction) type, but some of it is standard equipment for everyday use.

187415.name: Amazing Adventures: The Demon Hunter
187415.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Amazing Adventure Class!

Demon hunters tend towards lawful and good in alignment, but can be found in all shades and stripes. The very nature of their work can slowly degrade and corrupt their humanity, until some become as bad as the monsters they fight, and these are deadly adversaries indeed.

187416.name: Death Warrant (Supers!)
187416.description:
From publisher blurb:

I am the the one you need. I can make your problems go away. I will be a scalpel if you need one and the hammer when you don't. Show me your problems and I'll be the one to sign their Death Warrant.

Enemy Strike Files are character packs detailing a villainous threat for your SUPERS! Revised Edition games. The Enemies are extensively detailed so that they can be seamlessly integrated into your games; from a one-shot to an ongoing campaign

187417.name: Okhrana
187417.description:
From the document:

In Okhrana, no one person controls the game; everybody round the table gets the chance to input. Sometimes an individual will play the role of their protagonist, an émigré revolutionary who acts against the Czarist regime. Sometimes they will be asked to play the character of an antagonist, a member of the Okhrana, one of their informers, a spy or an ally in the French police, the Surete Generale.

Each player must create a protagonist for themselves. The protagonist is an individual upon whom a story will focus. That story is told in the form of six scenes, with the story of each protagonist being told, scene by scene, in order.

User summary:

The game originally was created in 24 hours as a 24-hour RPG contest entry.

187418.name: Reel Adventures
187418.description:
User summary:

Reel Adventures presents a system that attempt to recreate a cinematic style role-playing game with fast action and structured narrative arc. The system does not us a Game Master, instead cycling similar responsibilities among all players. The game is atypical in the amount of planning and setup that is needed before play begins. The group generates a "Reel Script" that features a synopsis and four "Acts" that guide the session and form the narrative arc. Play then proceeds based largely upon shared narrative development. Characters have three Abilities (Action, Emotion, Brains) that determine a dice pool for contested action resolution. The mechanic is a simple die pool roll vs. die pool roll with the highest total winning. The remainder of character generations focuses on methods to maintain a rapidly-paced narrative.

The game was provided as three downloadable PDF files--a one-page character sheet, a three-page Reel Script, and a twenty-one page rules document.

187419.name: A Sundered World
187419.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the cathedral drifts before the angel gate the priests begin chanting prayers, beseeching it to open a path so that they may once again begin the Golden Pilgrimage.

A ship loaded with firewater and other contraband from the City of Brass drifts silently through the Deep Astral, hoping to evade border islands...and whatever lurks in the darkness.

As a kytheran raiding fleet swiftly approaches, the soldiers of a dwarven multi-fort load elemental cores into an array of fire lances.

Thoughtform trembling with nervousness in front of so many enlightened Astral weavers, a t’pual battlemind begins its graduating shape-kata exam.

A mining vessel launches a series of towing chains into a stabilized earth mote. They begin to reel it in, hoping it won’t fluctuate before they can extract usable ore to process later.

The consuming darkness crawls towards the cold, pale spires of the elven city Astrazalian. Most of the inhabitants retreat behind closed doors: only the White Owls, nobility and the ignorant dare tread outside before it passes.

A Sundered World is a fantastic, kind of gonzo campaign setting for Dungeon World. It takes place in the shattered remnants of the worlds, which were ravaged during a cosmic war between the gods and primordials (which wiped them all out in the process). It includes:

Ten races, each with their own race moves, to better allow you to determine how much your race affects you (and serve as a foundation in case you want to flesh out an entire racial class). There's also guidelines and suggestions for using them in "default" Dungeon World games.
Six new classes.
New weapons, armor, dungeon gear (including poisons), services, transport options, hireling skills, buildings, and magic items.
Materials to further customize your weapons and armor: bind a wind spirit to your spear so that it flies further, shape a shield out of black ice, or don sturdy-yet-weightless armor shaped from raw astral essence.
Ships, both magical and mundane, to help you get around the Remnants, Maelstrom, and the darker regions beyond. There's ship-specific moves, plenty of example ships to choose from, and a section to help you build an entirely custom ship of your own design.
World moves for drifting through the astral, willing objects into existence using astral essence, lingering on as a ghost when you die, and more.
Eleven new monster settings, detailing glorious-yet-terrifying angels, sinister devils, cold, emotionless machines from the pre-Sundering era, spirits that managed to survive the Sundering, and strange beasts that were changed during the Sundering, or managed to adapt.
Six varied example campaign and adventure fronts to get you started.

187420.name: Quissama
187420.description:
Rio de Janeiro, 1868. Quissama is a fugitive slave from guaiamum malta who counts on English detective Woodruff to help him find Bernardina, his missing mother. At the same time, he needs to run from Alemão and his malta, who wants to capture him. Araújo wants to make his business prosper, but Alencar is eyeing the political influence. In the court, the Princess wants to set slaves freed, while the Emperor uses his power as he pleases. In the squares, you will face the capoeira fighting between Nagoas and Guaiamuns, which divide the Rio de Janeiro at the time. Choose your characters and take part in this plot!

How to play
Draw, combine and use your cards to establish your territory in Rio de Janeiro, 1868. Place your meeples and prosper thanks to coins that will help open trades, free slaves and employ capoeiras. With some card combinations, get the right to choose a character. Use your skills and reach your goal to win the match. But be careful with your opponents! They can cause malta attacks against your territory, deploy your ministers or steal the characters you worked hard to win. Go through all scandals and the power of money and be the first to reach one of your characters' goal!

187421.name: Don't Worry About the Asteroid... Worry About the Bomb!

rpg.28841: Don't Worry About the Asteroid... Worry About the Bomb!

rpgseries.28733: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs

187421.description:
From the Game
The Crew of the Lucky Penny have been having a particularly bad week. First, there was the power outage right in the middle of an asteroid belt. Then it was whispers of sabotage when the engine was found missing critical parts. Finally there was the little matter of the bomb...

187422.name: Wavemotion's 2015 One Page RPG and Character Sheet Contest Winner

rpg.28842: Wavemotions' 2015 One Page RPG and Character Sheet Contest Winner

rpgseries.28733: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs

187422.description:
User Summary

This is a card-based fantasy game which pits one or more players against a series of monsters and challenges created by the GM. It has a fantasy feel based on the character types but isn't tightly tied to any background.

It is worth mentioning that, despite the name, this was not the winning entry.

187423.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module FG1: The Forgotten Graveyard
187423.description:
From publisher blurb:

Face the horrors of the Forgotten Graveyard!

The crumbling necropolis has always been a dangerous place, crawling with undead and occasionally attracting the most unsavory characters. Word has reached the commander of the Border Patrol, though, that their may be some new evil afoot within the haunted depths of the Forgotten Graveyard. Can your characters survive long enough to find out what it is?

Universal Adventures The Forgotten Graveyard is a new Adventure Module. Set north of the town of Ravenor along the western edge of Greyshroud Ridge, you can combine the adventure with Expedition to Erathor and the expansion pack, Greyshroud Ridge, to create an overland journey. The Adventure Module includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards, 9 Dark Chasm cards, 9 Winged Statue cards, 9 Blackstone Tomb cards and 9 Infernex cards. In addition, The Forgotten Graveyard can be used as the surface area for additional adventures set beneath the necropolis.

Gather your heroes and enter the depths of the Forgotten Graveyard, if you dare. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, The Forgotten Graveyard can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

The Adventure Module is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you the ability to focus on the action and “story” while leaving you the option to include tactical action and combat if you desire. Enter a new and exciting world of adventure, full of wonder and surprises.

187424.name: Bards of Porphyra
187424.description:
From publisher blurb:

BARDS - Like you've never seen them before!

"Come closer now and listen..." The sweet tones of the bard retelling the tale of adventure, in song, music or movement is the culmination of heroic pursuit since time began. Adventuring bards supporting their allies in the thick of battle is doubly heroic! On the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, bards are stalwart supporters of the two sides of the ancient (some say ongoing) NewGod War between the Elementalists and the Deists. Think bards are just minstrels in a tavern? Get Bards of Porphyra, and meet...

The Cantor- ecclesiastic aide to clerics
The Gagaku- courtier to royals- with a secret weapon!
The Howler- one with the pack, baying down prey...
The Muzzein- calling the Elementalist faithful to prayer
The northern mystic, the laujala and the amazing holy fool, all waiting to seek adventure!




Bards of Porphyra also has new masterpieces (Music of the Spheres), magic items (the amazing Air Sitar) and spells (like Mass Benediction), all immersed in the upcoming World of Porphyra campaign setting - a great new take on an underestimated class!

187425.name: Gruesome Dragons
187425.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gruesome is Good

Dragons are incredibly dangerous threats, but their very popularity robs them of suspense. They fly, they have breath weapons, and you don’t want to get caught next to one when it full attacks.

The idea behind gruesome dragons is to make them more interesting for players and GMs. Rather than face yet another color-coded dragon encounter, the players find themselves facing a plague dragon capable of ending civilizations, or skittering draconic ambush predators obsessed with building the perfect adventurer trap. Gruesome dragons have uncanny appearances, smells, and sounds that makes them more frightening to even veteran characters.

187426.name: Gruesome Aberrations
187426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four Horsemen Present: Gruesome Aberrations!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have put together some frightening new options, perfect for adding some horror to your games or just throwing your players for a loop! Behold the Bound Horror, the Eternal, the Fleshwarper, and a mythic threat, the Old One. Gruesome templates you can use to turn any aberration into a unique threat your players will never forget!

187427.name: Gruesome Fey
187427.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four Horsemen Present: Gruesome Fey!

In conjunction with d20pfsrd and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have decided to put an end to cute little creatures with glittering wing dust and pastel hair. These are the Grimm fey who taught humans not to go into the woods at night!

The illusion-warping Believer, mythic Exiled Lord, hungering Faded, and sadistic Macabre will remind players they are only called the "fair folk" so they won't destroy your whole family. These gruesome templates allow GMs to turn any fey into the central figure of the kind of fairy tales where princes gouge out their own eyes.

187428.name: Gruesome Oozes
187428.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four Horsemen Present: Gruesome Oozes!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have developed some slimy scares perfect for proving not everything shiny is treasure! Run, don't walk, to pick up this volume which offers the otherworldly Intruder (which unmakes reality in its wake), the self-aware Emulation (hollowing out its victims from within), the multiplying Exponential (which constantly divides, and conquers), and the mythic threat of the Hive Mind (which seeks to protect its collective consciousness)!

187429.name: Gruesome Constructs
187429.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four Horsemen Present: Gruesome Constructs!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have built a set of horrifying after-market additions for constructs that'll have your players asking for a recall! This product offers new made-to-order templates to turn constructs into an Abandoned (a shield guardian gone horribly wrong), a mythic and sadistic Insane Intelligence (which is just what is sounds like), an angry Unbound (when the elemental animating the golem learns to control the cage construct around it), or a vicious Vivisector (which steals the flesh of the living to emulate life itself)!

187430.name: Pakuvresh: The Flesh Golem Factory
187430.description:
From publisher blurb:

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen have created a location free of any specific map, ready to be used to spark your own adventures or fill in the dark corners of an planar exploration that's gone places the GM didn’t expect.

A terrible citadel created by the Nether Mage, a long-since missing tenant, Pakuvresh is a dread factory endlessly churning out constructs of once-living flesh. The stronghold now drifts through shadowy realities, sending out bound fiends and using automated and undead labor to build a flesh golem armory… for unknown purpose.

187431.description:
From Yaah! magazine #4 published by Flying Pig Games:

Poland Strikes! is a standalone module in the Sticks and Stones series. The first entry, published by Flying Pig's sister company Tiny Battle Publishing, saw Soviets and Yankees fighting over precious land in Germany in post-nuclear 1987. While the USSR is distracted by all of this, Poland decides to settle the score with Hungary after years of escalating tensions along the border. With three scenarios and 88 counters gorgeously illustrated by wunderkind Christian Sperling (Neuschwabenland), it's a cold-war-goes-hot tactical combat game by the undisputed master of the genre.
187431.name: Poland Strikes!

187432.name: Returner Final Fantasy Role Playing Game Lite Version
187432.description:
Based upon the Returner FFRPG V2.0

From the foreword:

It's been discussed many times, particularly from newer people, about having a version of the Returner FFRPG that is possible to print out without hacking down the Amazon Rain Forest. After printing out three versions of the FFRPG (an earlier version, 1.2, and now 2.0), a Lite Version just might be necessary. Keep in mind that this is, by no means, a substitute for the complete HTML and Word versions of the FFRPG. Don't get me wrong: I'm not going to try and compress 200 or so pages into about 30. This is basically a quick reference guide for those who don't want to search through 200 pages of the complete version just to, say, find out the MDC progression of a Ranger. This can also be dubbed The FFRPG for Dummies, because it explains the system in a nutshell so newer FFRPG gamers and newer gamers in general can jump right in. In other words, this is the meat and potatoes.

187433.name: Monster Construction System
187433.description:
From the introduction:

Throughout the Final Fantasy series, monsters and the villains often played a role as equally important as that of the heroes themselves. What would Final Fantasy VI be without the antics of Kefka and Ultros if they didn't try getting into the Returner's way at every possible chance? The Monster Construction System gives gamemasters the chance to create their own memorable monsters to sick on their players - from gentle Rabites to fearsome dragons of the worst kind. If you have an idea for it, the Monster Construction System can help make it a reality.

187434.name: Vehicle Manual
187434.description:
From the introduction:

In most Final Fantasy games, gaining access to a vehicle (normally an airship) is an important step in the game. It allows the player to go to places where they were previously unable to go on by foot, chocobo, or, if it was available in the game, a boat. Normally a vehicle doesn’t really do much in the Final Fantasy games else.

But this Vehicle Manual does things differently.

Inspired by games such as Skies of Arcadia and Xenogears, the Vehicle Manual allows players or gamemasters to construct nearly any type of vehiclebe it a tank, mecha, submarine, airship, or spaceshipfor the Returner Final Fantasy RPG system. These vehicles can then be used to fight with other similar vehicles, which is what this sourcebook was created for. The Vehicle Manual includes comprehensive rules for vehicle creation, combat, equipment, enemy vehicles, and even gamemaster advice for campaigns where the game centers on the use of vehicles nearly as much as it does around the characters themselves.

187435.name: Returner Final Fantasy Roleplaying Game (2nd Edition)
187435.description:
From the introduction:

In 1990, the first Final Fantasy game saw an American release and in the eleven years since, the Final Fantasy has remained one of the best selling role-playing games for each of the console game systems that it has graced. This pen & paper roleplaying game, the Returner Final Fantasy RPG (often abbreviated as Returner FFRPG or just FFRPG), was designed to emulate the popular game series and similar titles from the "SNES era" such as Secret of Mana and Chrono Trigger. The Introduction includes the editor’s words of wisdom: From the Mouth of a Madman, the revision history that lists all the important changes made, a brief explanation on what a roleplaying game is, how to roll dice ("the fine art of chugging dice"), and the glossary of Final Fantasy RPG terminology.

187436.name: SeeD
187436.description:
User summary:

SeeD is a difficult rules set to summarize because of its modular design; character generation, for example, can follow one of six major methodologies: Class, Crystal, License, Job, Eidolon, or Limit Break. The method selected will depend upon the video game that is begin emulated as the basis of the table-top role-playing game. The Skill system is similarly modular, presenting three major systems: Talent, Reel, and Fortune. Inventory and outfitting will follow either: Equipment, Remodeling, or Bare. Finally, any of these various modules may be combined with any other combination to form a final basis of "pick and use" components that are selected primarily because they are the closest match to the emulated video game.

Generally, action resolution is percentile based and features a target number called the "Chance of Success". Players then roll percentiles and attempt to "roll under" the target. Depending upon which system(s) are being utilized, there are few to many modifiers that may apply.

The principle design goals of the system-of-systems are to 1) allow for the close emulation of nearly any video game roleplaying experience, and 2) present a fast-paced "video game" like playing experience.

187437.name: SeeD 2
187437.description:
User summary:

SeeD 2 is an evolution from SeeD, not a 2nd Edition. Instead of being completely modular, the Seed 2 implementation seeks standardization of rules which are designed for emulation of video games. In almost all respects, it is a more traditional generic, universal system than SeeD.

In SeeD 2, characters have six Attributes (Attack, Magic, Will, Vitality, Stamina, and Luck. Each Attribute is given a 6 during character creation and the player distributes into them 12 more points by fiat, to a maximum score of 10. Hit Points and Movement Points are then derived by formula. Characters begin play with one weapon and one armor. Characters select a Class (from a list of 12), but Class is much less structured than defined in the SeeD Class module. Characters may select Skills from a Class list; most Skills have special actions associated with them. The combat system offers various maneuvers during a round, including Attack. SeeD 2 utilizes a standard D100 roll against a target "Chance of Success" that is determined based on difficulty and modifiers. Players attempt to "roll under" the target.

187438.name: Præy for the Gods
187438.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




In Prey for the Gods, you play a lone hero sent to the edge of a dying world to discover the mystery behind a never-ending winter. Arriving with only the clothes on your back, you must survive the colossal dangers that you encounter. To restore balance and reclaim the land from the brink, you will be faced with questions that not even a god knows the answer to.

Source: The Game Website.

187439.description:
From the back of the box:

Join the stars of Cars 2 in 4 cool card games!

• Race to spot pics and get rid of your cards.
• Speed through the alphabet to find pics.
• Test your memory with a matching game.
• Combine cards to complete missions.

Start your engines! It's time for Pictureka Cars 2!

Four games included:
8-Away
Alphabetti
Matchureka
Pass the Pics
187439.name: Cars 2: Pictureka!

187440.description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
187440.name: Denmark (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

187443.name: Autocrat: The car trading game
187443.description:
From back of the box:
Each player is a dealer in new and used cars. Players compete with each other to make car sales. There is a lot of friendly Wheeling and Dealing as players try to earn enough money to buy the Ultimate Car.

A roll and move game where players aim to earn enough money to purchase a BMW and have it complete a lap of lap of the board. The includes opportunities to interfere with trades and sales other players are attempting to make. This represents the car traders competing to get a sale by offering a discount.

187444.description:
A fascinating educational game that tells you all about the ecology and life history of our extraordinary Australian frogs (description from the back of the game board)

The game is a roll and move. On about every third space there are instructions to follow (eg "Hot weather. Have a rest. Miss a turn.", "Jump for joy. You have found a mate already. Advance to 'Egg-laying lilypad.'", "DANGER You are eaten by a yabbie. Return to start.").

Sometimes the instructions are to take a "Tadpole" or a "Frog" card. These cards have a similar range of penalties and benefits as the board spaces with instructions. The frog cards are much larger than the tadpole cards, in full colour and include some factual information about frogs on them. A couple require the player to imitate a frog's call (described on the card) to receive the benefit.

There are two places where players get a choice of paths but other than that there is no choice in movement.
187444.name: Frogabout boardgame

187446.name: Who Am I? Music Edition
187446.description: Party quiz game about (mainly) pop stars. Each of the 55 large format (11.5 x 8 cm) cards gives five facts about a particular pop star. A player rolls a dice and is read the clue that corresponds to the number rolled. If they correctly identify the pop star, they win the card. The sixth fact on each card is the name of the pop star, so if they roll a 6 they automatically win the card. The game is won by the first player to win 5 cards. There are 9 special power cards that allow, for example, an extra clue or the opportunity to 'steal' a card. These are kept by the 'reader' who picks them up.
