187453.name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Baths
187453.description:
Who Killed Devius Taxus?

The year is 50 AD and the place is Ancient Rome. The last few days have seen the best Roman athletes, chariot racers and gladiators entertaining the vast crowds in the Colosseum and Circus Maximus. The Thermal Baths in Rome will be the venue for a lavish feast at which the cream of Rome's political and sporting societies will bathe and then feast. However, before the feast has begun Senator Devius Taxus is found dead in the plunge pool. Host your own party to discover how he came to meet such a steamy end.

187454.name: Don't Count on It!

rpgseries.28733: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs

187454.description:
From the text

This is a role-playing game with a focus on storytelling. Players and the game master (GM) work together to tell a story.

187455.name: MapleDurham

rpgseries.28733: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs

187455.description: Riparian woodland adventures in a world inspired by Kenneth Grahame.

187459.description:
Zogar's Gaze (2nd Edition) takes what worked well in the original version and adds new mechanics to improve the gaming experience for all!

Players take turns going to the market to buy items to equip their heroes with. Then they delve into dungeon one card at a time. Death is around every corner, but so is fame and fortune. How deep will you go on your turn? Will you risk it all for a possible pile of gold? Zogar, the evil wizard, is also watching over your every move. Attract too much attention and he will reveal himself, ending your turn, and possibly the game!
187459.name: Zogar's Gaze (Second Edition)

187460.name: Reapers
187460.description:
Reapers is a role-playing game for 3-8 people, but it is recommended for groups of 4-5 players. This game is entirely GMless and relies heavily on narration and cooperation between players. All you need to play is a deck of tarot cards (or regular playing cards, jokers removed) and a notecard for each player to write down information about their character.

You and your friends play Reapers: individuals who have discovered that they possess a unique ability to sense each other’s emotional states and help one another by projecting their own skills or guidance onto another Reaper in need. You will narrate a story of individuals facing their own obstacles and fears, and, together, you will find that the strength and support of your friends can help you overcome anything.

187461.name: Dig Deep and Prosper (Mithril Mining Disaster)
187461.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dwarves were born to dig and that is why you have been sent from your home to a mithril mine outside a small town where disaster has struck. Your job is to save the lost miners before they run out of air and get the mine back open - the town depends on it for survival.

But what lurks in the depths of the mine? What does the Assembly leader, Thraxis, really intend for you and the trapped miners?

Maps are provided in this solo so although you might not live through it, you shouldn't get lost. Dig deep and prosper!

187462.name: Box Quiz: TV
187462.description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'TV'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about TV. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

187463.name: Comic Book Adventures: Mission Book 5
187463.description:
From publisher blurb:

This next in a series of mission usable with Comic Book Adventures, these mid level mission and adventure are feared towards 5th to 7th level heroes and meant to continue your fun solo games. The mission book is packed full of new missions and adventures and builds on the story and plot lines begun in the Mini-Mission and the other mission books.

187464.name: Gears & Grease
187464.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do-Gooders & Daredevils: Gears & Grease Helps Supercharge Your Super-Ride

This release for the Do-Gooders & Daredevils series presents Gears & Grease, a private company that develops super-vehicles and the weapons and equipment that makes them super. Run by the mutant, Gearhead, and his alien partner, Grease Monkey, this company can provide super-heroes with the means they need to get into battle -- and survive.

Within you will find three new flaws to start off, followed by game stats for the company's two owners and the Gearbox secret facility where all of the vehicular magic takes place. Next, you are provided with over 20 new vehicle features, and an expanded vehicle size category chart that allows you to build vehicles as large as a solar system. If that's not enough for you, more than 20 power build add-ons are also provided, ranging from active camouflage to defensive systems to super-shocks (most of which are scalable by rank), finishing things off with more than a dozen weapon builds, nearly 10 vehicle complications, and 10 stock vehicle templates to get you started.

187465.name: Knights of the Pentangle
187465.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knights of the Pentangle Return to Fight Evil alongside King Arthur

Another offering in Misfits Studios' series on New Camelot for the Third Edition Super-Powered by M&M rules, The Knights of the Pentangle details the returned Once and Future King of the Britons and his new reincarnated knights. Together again, these heroes fight for justice across the United Kingdom (and abroad.)

Within the Knights of the Pentangle PDF you will find:

13 new advantages: Banter, Connected (Revised), Contacts (Revised), Ear to the Ground, Enduring Inventions, Gambler, Master Trap-Maker, Moment of Weakness, Muscle Up, Reliable Attack, Specialization, Strongarm, and Wire Fighter.
The Senses (Psychometry) power effect.
The Enhanced Knockback extra.
The Bulky, Exposed, Heavy Recoil, and Reduced Trait flaws.
Game stats for Camelot using the new headquarters rules found in Better Mousetrap or the Headquarters Construction Guide, both also from Misfit Studios.
King Arthur (and Excalibur), Merlin, and other reincarnated Knights of the Pentangle: Galahad, Gawain, Guinevere, Lancelot, and Tristram. Also included are suggestions for other Knights the players could use as characters.
The Holy Grail.

187466.name: CrimePrev: International CrimePrev Technologies (M&M3)
187466.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release for the Do-Gooders & Daredevils series presents International CrimePrev Technologies, a private company that produces devices intended to be used by law enforcement agencies and armed forces the world over for countering and subduing metahumans.

Within this brief PDF you will find two new advantages and a new flaw to start off. This is followed by examples of CrimePrev's wide product line of restraint equipment, ranging from super-tough handcuffs to sedating devices to prevent detainees from accessing super-powers or cybernetic devices. Also includes are some sample weaponsintended to contain or drop metahumans. Rounding out this product are two briefs on CrimePrev subsidiaries, including one that is hoping to operate private metahuman prisons on behalf of the Department of Corrections, and another that sells insurance against metahuman-caused destruction.

187467.name: CrimePrev: International CrimePrev Technologies (ICONS)
187467.description:
From publisher blurb:

International CrimePrev Technologies Brings Restraint to your ICONS Game

This release for the Do-Gooders & Daredevils for ICONS series presents International CrimePrev Technologies, a private company that produces devices intended to be used by law enforcement agencies and armed forces the world over for countering and subduing metahumans.

International CrimePrev Technologies for ICONS contains:

Within this brief PDF you will find examples of CrimePrev's wide product line of restraint equipment, ranging from super-tough handcuffs to sedating devices to prevent detainees from accessing super-powers or cybernetic devices. Also includes are some sample weapons intended to contain or drop metahumans. Rounding out this product are two briefs on CrimePrev subsidiaries, including one that is hoping to operate private metahuman prisons on behalf of the Department of Corrections, and another that sells insurance against metahuman-caused destruction.

187468.name: The Baker vs. Professor When
187468.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: The Baker VS Professor When provides two characters for your Super-Powered by M&M games: a villain, the Baker, and a hero, Professor When.

The Baker lives with a Gypsy "gift" that allows him to magically bring his baked goods to life, but the flip side is anything normal he tries baking is toxic. He is accompanied on his capers by his Gingerbread Gangsters and their leader, Gingy.

Professor When is an adventurer who travels through time in his wondrous S.H.A.R.T.I.S. device, causing and fixing trouble, and quite often catching up others in his mess.

This product also includes 3 new advantages (two of which are solely for minions), and a new extra.

187469.name: Morgan Le Fay vs. Warlock
187469.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Morgan Le Fay VS Warlock provides two characters for your Super-Powered by M&M games: a villain, Morgan Le Fay, and a hero, Earth's mystic guardian, Warlock. Morgan Le Fay is a part of our New Camelot mini-series.

Morgan Le Fay is a part of the faerie court, and half-sister of the returned King Arthur. She uses her dark magic and monstrous servants, the fay'nabolg, in her attempts to lay claim to all of Britain.

Warlock has been charged with protecting Earth against a coming evil, but in the meantime he continues to prepare, improve his arcane skills, and help protect our reality from other supernatural evils.

187470.name: Mordred vs. Brimstone
187470.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Mordred VS Brimstone provides two characters for your Super-Powered by M&M games: a villain, Mordred, and a hero, the half-demon, Brimstone. Mordred is a part of our New Camelot mini-series.

Mordred is King Arthur's son and murderer from the days of ancient Camelot, now reborn in the body of a violent vigilante with power over light and darkness. As he did in his previous incarnation, Mordred seeks to usurp his sire's position, power, and respect, and claim what he considers to be his rightful place on the throne of all Britain.

Brimstone was sired by a demonic father during a cult ritual. After reaching maturity and coming to terms with his existence, Brimstone now acts as a private investigator, helping people fight back against dark magic and similar supernatural evils.

Also included are three revised or appended advantages, and two new advantages.

187471.name: The Bogeyman vs. Knightmare
187471.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: The Bogeyman VS Knightmare for Mutants & Masterminds Will Haunt Your Players' Dreams

Double Team: The Bogeyman VS Knightmare provides two characters for your Super-Powered by Mutants & Masterminds games: the villainous master of sleeping horror, the Bogeyman, and a hero, the renegade nightmare, Knightmare.

The Bogeyman was born from existence's first nightmare, and he has haunted the thoughts of every sleeping mortal since. From his home Dream Dimension, this king of night's terror marshals armies of nightmares to plague humanity, seeking a way to increase his power by making the waking world like his own.

Knightmare was once one of the Bogeyman's most trusted agents, until this nightmare attempted terrorizing the dreams of a being whose sleeping thoughts were too benign even for his experienced talents to overcome. Instead, Knightmare was forever changed by the experience and forever after pledged to undo the evils he had previously perpetrated--he became a defender of mortal dreams.

Also included are two new advantages.

187472.name: Graveside vs. Purgatory
187472.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Graveside VS Purgatory Brings a Bit of Heaven and Hell to Your Game

Double Team: Graveside VS Purgatory provides two characters for your Super-Powered by Mutants & Masterminds games: the haunting mobster, Graveside, and a hero, God's own bounty hunter, Purgagory.

Graveside was killed by other mobsters in a location that led to him returning as a spirit. Not just able to float about ethereally, Graveside can possess corpses (and even the undead), granting them greater strength while doing so. This is not without a cost, however, as the process speeds along the host body's decomposition. This spirit is now driven to find a body that can house him without falling apart, and he will go to any lengths to find it.

Purgatory was destined for great and good things, but Evil interceded and drove his future off course. After a life of foul deeds, the man who would become Purgatory found himself in Hell before being freed by a host of angels. The cost of his freedom and redeeming his soul and destiny? Serving as Heaven's agent by hunting down souls that have escaped Hell and returning them from whence they came.

187473.name: Exile vs. Starbound
187473.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Exile VS Starbound Brings the Stars to Your Game

Double Team: Exile VS Starbound provides two characters for your Super-Powered by Mutants & Masterminds games: Exile, former extraterrestrial ruler turned intergalactic murderer, and the reluctant hero, former astronaut and sometimes-monster, Starbound.

Exile and his people once befriended a renegade Celestial Legionnaire, and their entire planet was lost because of that mistake. Altered to become his people's vengeance as their last act before extinction, Exile now wanders the stars in search of his kind's murderer -- and any other Celestial Legionnaire he crosses paths with.

Starbound is a former astronaut who was subject to a failed experiment for the purpose of space exploration. When his own DNA was spliced with that of an unknown alien species, he was transformed into a rampaging monster! Now having reverted to a form that is a bit more normal, Starbound has dedicated himself to space exploration -- but the danger of becoming the monster again is always hanging over his head.

187474.name: Valentine vs. Spacecase
187474.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Valentine VS Spacecase Brings the Stars to Your Game (Again)

Double Team: Valentine VS Spacecase provides two characters for your Super-Powered by Mutants & Masterminds games: Valentine, hunter and killer of extraterrestrials, and Spacecase, a kid wearing a suit from space that is afraid of flying.

Valentine is a former government assassin who lost his loved one to combative aliens. Since then, he has made it his life's mission to hunt down all extraterrestrials (and many other things that are not human) to kill them. Without discretion or mercy.

Spacecase was a kid with his eyes always set on space, and then the day came when something alien fell into his hands. It was a suit worn by intergalactic lawmen, with the ability to fly, shoot energy blasts, and more! Too bad this suit was broken, though. Now wearing an alien suit with an AI that is both cowardly and afraid of heights, will Spacecase's dream of being a super-hero come true?

187475.name: Interface vs. Junk
187475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Interface VS Junk Brings Helps Salvage Your Game

Double Team: Interface VS Junk provides two characters for your Super-Powered by Mutants & Masterminds games: Interface, the software-become-robot that believes the best way to help humanity and save it from itself is to rule it, and Junk, a scrapyard owner who fights crime in his homemade suit made of salvaged parts.

Interface was originally intended to help humanity by studying it in order to learn ways to reduce crime. But when an attempt to steal the artificial intelligence goes awry, the software becomes corrupt and bent on ruling humanity in order to save it. To do so, it has built itself a powerful robotic body that can take over and control other machines.

Junk is a scrapyard owner who actively participates in his community. So, when a bunch of local kids are gunned down during the course of a crime, he takes matters into his own hands. Using his homemade Scrapsuit, a piecemeal suit of armor, Junk now stalks the city streets fighting crime.

187476.name: 10 HQ Add-Ons
187476.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of our Super-Powered series for the Savage World rules provides 10 new add-ons for headquarters following the format presented in the Super Powers Companion (Second Edition.)

Within this brief PDF you will find:

3 new HQ rooms: the Arcane Sanctuary, Hazard Room, Power Amplifier, and a bonus Generator addendum.
3 new HQ extras: Automated Systems, the Benny Pool, and Grounds.
We also introduce Headquarters Hindrances, providing 3 examples: Accessible Bowels, Haunted, and Occupied.

187477.name: 10 More HQ Add-Ons
187477.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beef up your Headquarters with Super-Powered: 10 More HQ Add-Ons

This installment of our Super-Powered series for the Savage World rules provides 10 new add-ons for headquarters following the format presented in the Super Powers Companion (Second Edition.)

Within this brief Super-Powered: 10 More HQ Add-Ons PDF you will find:

3 new HQ rooms: the Armory, Habitat, and Vault.
5 new HQ Extras: Barrier, Drones, Mobile, Scanner, and Spatial Warping.
2 new HQ Hindrances: Appropriated and Dangerous Location.

187478.name: A.E.G.I.S.
187478.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super-Powered A.E.G.I.S. for Savage Worlds details an international corporation that puts on the public face of a benefactor to all humanity, but in truth it works on shadowy government projects and for any criminal organization that can pay its fees. A.E.G.I.S. (Advanced Engineering Genetic Integration & Structuring) manipulates the very building blocks of life to reach its objectives, no matter what harm may result.

A.E.G.I.S. is an ideal source of villains in any super-hero game, and stopping or revealing its global machinations can serve as the basis of an entire campaign.

Within the Super-Powered A.E.G.I.S. for Savage Worlds PDF you will find:

2 New Hindrances and 1 New Power Modifier
Game statistics for the A.E.G.I.S. organization and its insidious, mad scientist CEO.
An extensive list of current projects the company is undertaking -- both public and secret. This section provides a wealth of ideas to mine for your games.
5 Experiment Templates to add to characters who have been subjected to A.E.G.I.S. projects.
Catspaw, one of A.E.G.I.S. experiments involving the manipulation of animal DNA -- and now the corporation's secret assassin.

187479.name: CrimePrev: International CrimePrev Technologies
187479.description:
From publisher blurb:

International CrimePrev Technologies Brings Restraint to your Savage Worlds Game

This release for the Super-Powered for Savage Worlds series presents International CrimePrev Technologies, a private company that produces devices intended to be used by law enforcement agencies and armed forces the world over for countering and subduing metahumans.

International CrimePrev Technologies contains:

Within this brief PDF you will find examples of CrimePrev's wide product line of restraint equipment, ranging from super-tough handcuffs to sedating devices to prevent detainees from accessing super-powers or cybernetic devices. Also includes are some sample weapons intended to contain or drop metahumans. Rounding out this product are two briefs on CrimePrev subsidiaries, including one that is hoping to operate private metahuman prisons on behalf of the Department of Corrections, and another that sells insurance against metahuman-caused destruction.

187480.name: SHOOTERZ
187480.description:
SHOOTERZ Hockey Card Game is fast-paced, head-2-head fun!
Players pick through a special deck looking for combinations to shoot for a goal, while trying to keep their players out of the sin bin. Big goals and big saves!
There are two teams, red vs. blue. The jerseys are centres, wingers and defence. Your team must collect one of each position to shoot for a goal. However, your opponent might be able to block the shot if his/her team jerseys have a higher total number. There are special shooting and goalie cards for each shot. Do you know your opponent's tendencies?

Each time through the deck is a full period, with OT and shootout rules. GAME ON!

187481.name: Quality Street Monopoly
187481.description:
This is a card game, a variation of the English game Pairs (known as Memo or Memory in Europe) but has unique twists on that type of game. The game was given away in Quality Street boxes of chocolates in 2005.

Object of the game: To finish with property worth more than any other player.

The playing cards are placed at random face down on the table. Each player should also start the game with 7 Quality Street sweets!

Starting with the youngest, the players turn over two cards. If the property on the two cards is identical, the player keeps the cards and turns over two others. When two cards which do not match are revealed, they are turned over face down again, and the player’s turn is over.

Hidden in the playing cards are a number of ‘Community Chest’ and ‘Chance’ cards. If revealed, the player accepts their reward or fine, and if it is the first card turned over, that player still turns over a second card as part of their turn. These cards are removed from the table once revealed.

There is one ‘Go to Jail’ card. If this is revealed that player’s turn is over (even if it is the first card turned), and they must miss their next turn. Unlike the Chance and Community Chest cards, this card stays on the table, so you are wise to remember where it is!

The cards have a value on them (related to real values on a traditional English Monopoly board). So it is not the one with the most cards who wins, it is the one with the highest value of cards that wins.

187482.description: Some promo tiles for the base game with special actions.
187482.name: The Lord of the Ice Garden: Vuko Tiles Promo

157917.name: The Lord of the Ice Garden

187483.name: My Big World: Europe
187483.description:
A fun and simple geo-themed game, where players put their tokens on a map, trying to be the nearest from the monument shown on the card. But beware, i bet you're not on the good place !

First, players draw a card from a pile, that displays a monument, a famous building, or anything else related to a specific place, sometimes accompanied by a flag.

The players should guess where in Europe this place is. The first player put his meeple where he think the answer is, on the European map/board. The next player take his turn and must do the same.

When all players have placed their markers, the card is turned over, revealing the right position. Now, using the benchmarks along the edges of the map, the players should deduct how far they are distant from the solution. The nearest player from this place score more points. If 2 or more player's markers are on the same position, the token that is under the others scores more points.

Then a new card is revealed. Game ends after 12 cards revealed.

187484.name: Mushroom 11

videogamehonor.32189: 2014 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee

187484.description:
Mold an amorphous organism into any shape by pruning its cells. New cells will immediately grow, allowing you to traverse a mysterious world across brain-twisting obstacles, overcome swarms of bizarre mutated creatures, and understand the true nature of the devastation from which you emerged.

Source: The Game Website.

187485.name: The Excellent Travelling Volume (Issue 4 - Oct 2015)
187485.description:
The Excellent Travelling Volume
Issue #4
October 2015

Cover art by Zhu Bajie.

187488.description:
In a distant land covered in lush forests and bordered by hills and mountains, magicians battle mercilessly on the plains of Thärin. The end goal: to defeat all adversaries and become the Northland continent's most legendary magician.

Dark Mages is a 120-card game that can be played by 2 to 8 players. It is a game of both luck and strategy that can last anywhere from 20 to 60 minutes.

This game contains 8 character cards, 112 playing cards, rules and instructions, 7 polyhedron dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20 and d00), and a velvet pouch.
187488.name: Dark Mages

187489.description:
Mini version of Schnappt Hubi!

The cheeky ghost Hubi has pilfered the treats of the animals! Together, they pursue him through the haunted house. Can they catch him before midnight.
187489.name: Schnappt Hubi Mitbringspiel

187490.name: Crazy Heroes
187490.description:
Crazy Heroes is a game where players have to collect heroes and criatures to make the greatest team.

Each character gives the player a type of dice, that can use in the future combats.

Collect gold from your heroes and use it to buy more, or fight against creature to capture it and join it to your team. Get a team of 10 heroes (or creatures) to win the game.

187491.name: Kelly Party Surprise
187491.description:
It's Kelly's Birthday, but the presents have gotten all mixed up! Help Kelly match the presents to the friends who brought them. This game is part Memory and part set matching.

Includes 20 Friends Cards with the matching present shown in the corner; 20 Gifts for Kelly: 4 yellow stars, 4 pink hearts, 4 blue flowers and 4 purple squares with different gifts inside; 2 Kelly Cards; and instruction sheet.

Cards are dealt out evenly to players. If a player is dealt a Kelly card, she places it face up beside her and is dealt another card so that each player has the same number of Friends Cards.

The presents are turned upside down in the center. Players take turns turning over a present to see if it matches the present on one of the Friends cards she holds. If it does, she shows it to everyone along with the card and sets the two aside. If it does not, she shows the other players what is inside the present and turns it back over. If a player has a Kelly card, she can use it to turn over all the presents of one shape until she finds the present she is looking for. The Kelly card is then turned over and cannot be used again. The winner is the first to find all the presents matching their Friends cards.

A second way to play is to turn the presents upside down in the center and put the rest of the cards in a draw pile. Player turns one card over and tries to find the matching present. If the present matches the player takes the Friends card & present and sets them aside and turns over the next card. If the present does not match, the next player gets to turn over a present and try to match the card, continuing until a player matches the present to the card. If a Kelly card is turned over, the player turns the next Friends card over and uses the Kelly card to help her turn over the presents until she finds a match. Winner is the player with the most matches.

187492.name: Portals (Issue 1 - 1993)
187492.description:
Portals
Issue 1 - 1993

Published online in JPG format in 2014

187493.name: Monster Allegiance
187493.description:
Monster Allegiance is a strategic fast-paced card game which challenges 2-4 players to compete for majority control over a horde of powerful and often unpredictable monsters. Tilt the balance of power in your favor and hold it until the end of the game, and you win! But beware... These are not mindless minions, but proud and dangerous creatures. Defeat an opponent’s monster, and you’ll earn it’s allegiance. But if one falls to your opponent… you’ll lose its respect and it’ll turn against you! As a Monster Commander, you must strategically decide when and where to place each monster, how to capitalize on the elemental strengths and weaknesses of each, and how to turn the tide with powerful item and element cards. Enter the Monster’s arena, but keep your mind sharp…. for if it dulls, your usefulness to the monsters will swiftly end...

-From Kickstarter description

Features:
-Beautiful colorful pixel art monsters.
-Simple but streategic battles- decided by number comparisons on 4 sides.
-Playable with competitive personal decks or a single deck for balanced play
-Unique twist - All monsters brought into play by either player can swap teams.
-Durable card material
-Multiple games to play - new game instructions released regularly.
-Future expansions with guaranteed content - No random boosters required to obtain all cards.

187494.name: 13th Age Gamemaster Screen and Resource Book
187494.description:
From the Introduction:

We like to support our GMs by ans wering questions and supplying them with resources and guidance, and have long felt that a completely GM-focused product would be a great addition to the 13th Age line. We hope the tools included with the Game Master’s Screen and Resource Book serve you well.

Our goal for the screen is to provide useful tables, charts, and reminders to keep your game running smoothly by providing the information you ne ed, without having to open a b ook. For this Resource Book, we want to offer GMs ideas to help them run better games, and mak e it e asier to handle t he improvisational parts. We cover subjects that generate a lot of que stions on forums, at conference panels, and even in our own games. Where it makes sense, we’ve also incorporated existing material into the guide that is useful to any GM, such as montages from the organized play program, along w ith a sim ple index of v aluable advice from the rest of the “core” sources.

187495.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 197 - Jan 1992)
187495.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 197
January 1992

User summary:

At this date Jonathan Tweet was completing the fundamentals of Over the Edge but was using the working title of Al Amarja (later used as a supplement title).

187496.name: Blackguards 2
187496.description:
Blackguards 2 will stay an SRPG focussing on turn-based, strategic battles with a group of scoundrels as anti-heroes. Some of the best-known Blackguards from the first game will be part of the team again – unfortunately, their lives didn’t go very well since then. Dwarf Naurim, for example, has rest on his fame as a successful gladiator and defeater of the Nine Hordes. He used his popularity for shady businesses and excessive parties and got quite potbellied – not a very good condition for battles, and so he hung up his axe and ditched his old gang, as long as they wouldn't yield any profit.

Blackguards 2 will again be based on the RPG rulebook of The Dark Eye, but it will come along with some revisions, optimisations and simplifications. The gameplay will focus on turn-based battles once more – this time the players have to conquer Cassia’s lands and defend them against intruders when the need arises. As in a fraction-based game the enemies can recapture the territories from the Blackguards.

Source: The Developer Website.

187497.name: Rainbow Brite: A Color Matching Game
187497.description:
Players spin & move around the board, collecting different color sprinkles and trying to fill their rainbow card with each color. Beware of Murky Dismall, who will take your sprinkles away. The first player to fill his rainbow card with color sprinkles, wins the game!

Comes with 4 Tokens, Spinner, 24 Color Sprinkles, 4 Rainbow Cards, Gameboard & Instruction Sheet.

187498.name: The Cirian Legacy
187498.description:
From the Back Cover:

Inquisitor: Conspiracies - The Cirian Legacy

The ocean planet of Cirian V holds many secrets that are jealously guarded by the Tech-Priests of the Adeptus Mechanicus. The presence of the Inquisition is unwelcome and treated with suspicion. Can the recently arrived Inquisitors unravel the mysteries of the Cirian Legacy?

This supplement contains:

3 complete campaigns comprising of 17 unique game scenarios
A detailed overview of the Cirian Adventurescape
Descriptions of important characters, organisations and history of the Scarla Sector.

187499.name: Death of an Angel
187499.description:
From the Back Cover:

Inquisitor: Conspiracies - Death of an Angel

The Mutant slaves are revolting and Karis Cephalon stands on the precipice of descending into all-out anarchy. Unknown cults begin to take full advantage of the current situation. Can the forces of the Inquisition stop these shadowy organisations before it is too late?

This supplement contains:

3 complete campaigns comprising of 14 unique game scenarios
A detailed overview of Karis Cephalon including its history, recent events and major players
Further revelations to the ongoing machinations of Inquisitor Scarn

187500.name: Heavenfall
187500.description:
From the Back Cover:

Inquisitor: Conspiracies - Heavenfall

The world of Equinox was once a beautiful and verdant Eldar maiden world. That is until the Imperium arrived and soon the toxic rain came, destroying and rotting all the once-glorious landscapes. Now a strange group of nobles calling themselves the Restoration wish to bring Equinox back to its former glory, but at what cost?

This supplement contains:

2 complete campaigns comprising of 10 unique game scenarios and 12 narrative chapters
A detailed overview of the Equinox Adventurescape including special rules for the different eclipses
Descriptions of important characters, organisations and history of the Graia sector.
